description: Radish cakes still my favourite item from here Seaweed mushroom bean curd roll comes a close second Gyozas here are good considering that its pretty hard to find good gyozas New vegan bbq pork baos are tasty the pork is super tender and melt in your mouth but I wish the bao was fluffier Crispy vegan oysters are okay nothing special Its hard to find vegan food in Richmond so this is a decent option
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Bryan F.
description: Every time this place is amazing They have some of the best food out there Their range of options is fantastic and their customization is equally so We love their Kung Pao Bean Curd and Spicy Szechuan hot pot but everything weve had there has been fantastic Also the staff is excellent I cant recommend this place enough
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Andrew C.
description: 4 stones gets 5 stars Why you might ask  Purely vegetarian cuisine that is super flavorful not too salty and extremely creative with their dishes  Priced right for the amount of food you get What to get in order  Kung Pao Veg Chicken Yep had to roll my eyes at the thought of this one but this definitely takes the cake Super flavorful fully packed with veg chicken  Grilled veggie unagi Looks like unagi tastes like unagi but its tofu and bean curd Wow  Eggplant and Basil Standard eggplant and basil dish because who doesnt want veggies at a vegetarian restaurant  Veg Beef Brisket Stew This was an interesting take on beef brisket Chewy beef brisket with fat and tons of flavor This is a place with a small parking lot and a place where you need to order at the counter pay and then find a seat Nothing fancy but super delicious Would definitely go back again if in the Richmond area
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Jason F.
description: This is one of the best restaurants in Richmond right now The food is rich and satisfying the prices are reasonable they do not ask for tips when picking up as it should be and the staff are very fast and professional The ingredients are also very natural and will energize you not leave you in a food coma afterwards Whether youre vegetarian or not youll love the entire menu Im tempted to get a job in the kitchen just to steal the recipes for myself but until then Ill continue to order from here every 3-4 weeks at least My only recommendation for the restaurant would be to switch to paper takeout packaging where possible Number 5 plastics are not allowed in Richmond recycling bins currently
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Stephy Y.
description: Pretty high ratings for a vegetarian place Maybe Im not a vegetarian and dont really see why it came out with 4/5 on yelp They do have plenty of options to choose from with many meat dishes that were made into a vegetarian version I did want to try their fried chicken nuggets but it wasnt on their menu anymore So dishes I tried  Satay Beef with Gai Lan 3/5 Now the beef tasted nothing like actual beef but thats ok The dish itself renders 3 out of 5 because it was just ok in terms of flavour Im not looking for it to replicate the actual dish cause you just cant Beef is beef and mock beef wont be the same  3 cups of burdock  Veg meat 1.5/5 The burdock itself tasted ok The sauce it was in wasnt pleasing to the palate and didnt really speak 3 cups flavour to me I wasnt sure if the veg meat was mixed in with the burdock but I didnt see on its own The veg that this came with was just cabbage  Veg beef brisket stew 2/5 This was a tomato base stew with had veggies and mock beef Id say this had variety but again the base was just ok Spicy sauce with veg beef brisket pot 2.5/5 This one had the same ingredients as the stew above however this one had a spicy pickled base and for some reason if you get this in a combo you wont be getting the side dishes You will however still get rice and soup We got the combo and you get a choice of white or brown rice chinese herbal soup or mix veggie and some side dishes I thought I knew what chinese herbal soup was but let me tell you they werent joking when they said herbal So be ready for some herbal taste if you decide to order this I wish I had gotten the veggie option cause it was too much for me So overall I wasnt expecting this dinner to replace my meatful dinners but rather allow me to enjoy meatless nights while still enjoying the flavours of dishes I liked However it did not live up to expectations I wont be returning as I could have spent 70+ having some delicious meatless dishes elsewhere
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Pam C.
description: I visited this place with Zi Y on a Friday night at 5pm They werent busy right at 5 as they just opened for dinner hours but became busy around 6pm We were first timers at this famous vegetarian restaurant in Richmond and Im so happy we came We decided to bring our families here next time because their fake meat actually tasted really good I havent had meat in so long that I forgot what real meat tastes like so I cant compare it with real meat but Ill say that this fake meat doesnt suck They served side dishes with a few choices of soup They also offered white or brown rice We ordered quite a few dishes for two petite girls lol Everything we ordered was delicious Staff were so sweet as well I will definitely bring my friends and family here I miss this place already
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Amita J.
description: This was an interesting place It looks sketchy from the outside inside however is ok The service was odd did not realize on their menu it said we had to order at least one item per person so instead of giving us time to look a little more at the menu she just kept making things off and saying we could order something small which was still 9+ dollars Felt like we were feeling rushed All of their prices seemed very off based on what you get with the combo meal  full entree The food itself was mostly really good We ordered the Kung Pao chicken which was the best thing and most popular ordered Definitely recommended We ordered a tofu dish as well which was good but unfortunately do not recall what its called The stand dumplings were ok but the gyoza was delicious
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Ayaka H.
description: Its easy to give 4 stones vegetarian a solid 5 stars Their lunch combos are priced above average at 15 but their portions are large quality is high and ingredients fresh I tried the veg fish on cream sauce with rice combo with veg fried chicken and both were insanely delicious enough to make me plan my next visit so that I could try everything on the menu The goji berries herbal soup that comes as a side with the combo is so nourishing and I want that recipe so I could have it everyday Most menu items are vegan and the rest are vegetarian Veg food doesnt have to be boring look at the attached pics I would guarantee even non vegs would enjoy it Dont forget to check out their fridge where they have assorted veg meats for home cooking As a side note hole in the wall type place with excellent service and clean bathrooms
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Cherry W.
description: Love this place My dad and I have been coming for over 10 years It appears that recently they may have change management They now require you to pay over the counter Most of their options are vegan friendly Very flavourful and more Taiwanese style vegetarian cuisine It is on a pricier side but there are a fair amount of food You can see that they put a lot of love and effort in their food Totally recommend even if you are not vegetarian
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: John V.
description: Great little restaurant Food taste great and with good service and large portions They dont really take reservations but call 30 mins ahead and they will try to save you a seat The parking is terribly cramped and limited The decor is an afterthought This place is all about the food Go for the food bang for your buck Dont go for crappy parking situation small restaurant
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Patricia F.
description: Ive been wanted to go here for ages Reading all the reviews got me excited so I had high expectations and they delivered Family run spot in Richmond Good prices as well and lots of selection I cant wait to come back and try more food We ordered 3 dishes between 4 people and had leftovers One hot pot a spicy fried mushroom dish SO GOOD and the wintermelon soup SO GOOD Be careful of the floor its extremely slippery
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Najat S.
description: 4 Stones was the highlight of my dining experiences in my weeklong visit to B.C Tucked in the unassuming Minoru Plaza it is a mere 500 meter walk from the Richmond-Brighouse transit station I arrived at 7:30pm on a Thursday night so service was speedy Ordering is easy at this counter-service joint simply browse the two double-sided laminated menus make your selection and pay If you order a combo it comes with your choice of soup rice white or brown a side dish and fruit The SPICY BEAN PASTE VEGAN BEAN CURD FISH pictured on the placard on the counter was my selection Within ten minutes my side dishes soup and rice arrived followed by my steaming hot main dish fragrant with fermented bean paste and ginger I loved the contrast of textures between the springy bean curd fish chewy mushrooms and crunchy Chinese celery My vegetable soup was flavourful and the side of slightly cooked spinach with vinegar was a great counterpoint to my spicy main dish The portions were generous and I appreciated the fruit topped with sunflower and pumpkin seeds If you are vegetarian and love Chinese food dont miss this place
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Shila B.
description: Atmosphere There is a bit of a hole in the wall vibe however I recommend coming here as you will not be disappointed Service Not friendly The instructions for ordering the items itself was confusing which may have added to her slight hostility toward me Price Market value Food For a vegetarian place there was a lot of selection and I was slightly overwhelmed...in a good way The portions are large and respectable The fake vegetarian fish on rice was actually surprisingly decent
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Leena S.
description: Very good vegetarian restaurant The food tasted really good The kungpow chicken is a must I have not had vegetarian Gyoza since I become a vegetarian Best Gyoza ever The udon noodles were good as well Very large portions Food was great but have to give only 3 stars given the service was very poor But I guess thats expected at those smaller types of restaurant
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Phi G.
description: My friend told me of this Chinese vegan product that would fool any meat eater So I set out to find it 4 Stones came up on yelp search I never go to Richmond but I decided to make the trek The place is small and a tight entrance for those with strollers scooters or wheelchairs The pictures make it seem upscale and nice Lets be honest its a room with some dated tables and chairs Everything is vegan even though the pictures look like meat I was so excited that I ordered the fried chicken nuggets and beef brisket stew The 3 item appetizers is not appealing Pine nuts on fresh fruit is fucking gross The tofu I didnt try The veggie was the only decent part Fried chicken nuggets looked amazing I was so stoked And then I ate one My biggest issue is the crispy/crunchy deception You look at the pictures and think ohhh yeah kfc xtra crispy goodness But what you actually get is a disappointing thin layer of crust that doesnt crunch The beef brisket stew tasted like its meat version I could not tell the difference The fake beef looked convincing too But after awhile I got this weird queasy feeling Its the same feeling I got when I found out Subway essentially used micro plastic in their breads I stopped loving everything and was concerned these Chinese fake meats might have stuff in it that isnt healthy I was wasteful and didnt eat 1/4 of anything And I didnt dare take it home Im pretty sure the waitress was offended but I wont return
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Emme P.
description: Pretty good vegetarian restaurant Kung pao chicken-3/5 Very flavorful the fried part got a bit soggy near the end felt like there was a lot of reading Salt and pepper chicken 3/5 Flavor was a bit different from the traditional Taiwanese popcorn chicken but still good I dipped it in the Kung pao sauce
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Liza M.
description: The best Taiwanese restaurant Ive tried in Canada Im so glad I made a trip out to Richmond I came with a group of 7 for a late lunch on a holiday We waited at most 5 minutes and ordered 9 entrees for a celebration Service was great but maybe because we ordered a lot right at the beginning Some of the entrees came with brown rice and herbal soup Overall a great experience delicious appetizers and entrees I would definitely visit again if Im in the area 1 Crispy Veg Cutlet w Curry Sauce on Rice  MUST TRY 2 Grilled Veggie Unagi  SUPER GOOD 3 Mushroom Seaweed Bean Curd Roll  SUPER GOOD 4 Kong Pao Veg Chicken with walnuts Just the right amount of crispiness and sauce 5 Tomato  Veg Beef Brisket Noodle Soup  as good as vegetarian beef noodle soup can get 6 Veg Beef Noodle Soup  tastes similar to tomato  veg beef brisket noodle soup 7 Burdock  Veg Meat Pot  comes with plenty of sauce thats great over rice Burdock adds an interesting and fun texture 8 Spicy Sauce w Veg Beef Brisket Pot  comes with plenty of sauce thats great over rice 9 Spicy Kimchi Chow Mien  this was served last The plate of noodles was garnished with cute fried circular vegetable It was great since long noodles and a circle are both great symbols of longevity good luck and fortune We were all super full by the time this came out so I dont think I appreciated this as much as I could have on an emptier stomach Complimentary side dishes come in a tray partitioned into threes 1 Mustard greens  really good served with sesame oil 2 Cherry tomato grape cantaloupe apple dried cranberries pine nuts and almonds 3 Aged/spiced tofu  could eat just this and rice for an entire meal
name: 4 Stones Vegetarian Cuisine

author: Mateo D.
description: Amazing service by Shefali Jess and Jaycobe Thanks guys and also great options Had a happy face and it was delicious Also shefali prepared me a Matcha latte also really good Thank you
name: Buddha-Full

author: Nicole B.
description: Went to the North van location yesterday and feasted on some Vegan veg and drinks The bohemian bowl was okay fresh carrots beets lentils and brown rice with a decent warm sauce It didnt knock my socks off The green juice was tasty and comes in a nice sized glass bottle They have juice shots I ordered the fireball and gagged because it tasted like salad dressing so I took it home and poured it on my salad My daughter ordered the happy face smoothie and said it was delicious The avocado toast was okay but even the spicy was bland
name: Buddha-Full

author: Paula F.
description: Wonderful little vegan vegetarian eatery next to the Quay My daughter and I are visiting Vancouver from California and just had a lite lunch here It was our first stop We throughly enjoyed it This eatery is environmentally conscious and minimalistic in waste Compostable to go containers are used for to go items and regular washable plates bowls and utensils are used for dining in There was one communal table and a few smaller tables inside and a small patio area outside in front The menu filled with yummy plant-based options adorned the wall as you walk in Choices included smoothies Acai bowls wraps Buddha bowls salads toasts sides shots teas and kombuchas A huge selection of pastries on display behind glass were also available They also had a menu option for dogs We chose the Berry Bliss Acai Bowl and the Bohemian Soul Bowl The Acai bowl came out in a reasonable amount of time The Buddha bowl took a little longer Both presented well with plenty of bright colors and tasted great Prices were a little high but well worth the price The ingredients were fresh healthy and locally grown and/or brought in Service was friendly and helpful We have a few more days in Vancouver We will definitely visit Buddha-full again before we leave
name: Buddha-Full

author: Josephine W.
description: I dropped in to Buddhafull during the Hot Chocolate Festival as I was curious about their mushroom hot chocolate The shop is inviting and cute with lots of greenery and wood accents The drink I had was called Ancient Wisdom a raw dark hot chocolate with adaptogenic healing mushrooms and a light spice The rim had some sweet spices that was delicious I love dark hot chocolate and I could taste the mushrooms It worked quite well I would come back to try some of their other dishes Lots of healthy items on their menu
name: Buddha-Full

author: Meredith D.
description: Have been in here a couple times and hadnt reviewed Recently grabbed take out from here with a couple immunity boosting drinks and ramen bowl Ill admit that vegan/vegetarian doesnt usually excite me but it hit the spot and definitely something we will shortlist going forward
name: Buddha-Full

author: Jessica W.
description: Popped in as I was walking the neighborhood and looking for a healthy option A great storefront selling lots of local items so I loved looking around and finding some new local artisans Went to order and the person working the till seemed very friendly but during the lunch hour rush with a long line they were chatting long periods with each customer as I was about 4th in line when I went to order and many more coming in during my wait I get friendlyness but during the rush period on a weekday was a little frustrated Then it took over 15 minutes for the avo toast I ordered so I finally had to ask for it to go as I was due back for work and no longer had time to stay and eat The avo toast itself was wonderful  really great mix not just slabbing avocado on some bread so it was worth the long wait in the end and will go back in the future for sure just making sure I get myself a little extra time And the fact it came in a heart well that was overly adorable Also they had some amazing vegan desserts wish I picked one up
name: Buddha-Full

author: Brittany F.
description: Ive been a loyal customer of Buddha-Full for years Back in the day it was somewhat of a cult following for yogis and health junkies but has recently become popular among the broader Vancouver crowd Im usually sucked into their Lobo smoothie and mint Nanaimo bar which are inconsistent in quality but good for the most part Today I decided to venture outside of the norm and have to say it was regrettable I got the pumpkin smoothie which is fine tastes like blended pumpkin pie and is overwhelmingly spiced with nutmeg The mistake was the raspberry cheesecake which was so stale I was pretty dissatisfied so I brought it back to the counter and the employee seemed annoyed by my complaint I asked to exchange it for a different dessert that was actually a lower price than what I paid but she said I had to get the same cheesecake I reluctantly agreed This second slice was even more rock hard than the first see picture I took one bite and left the rest Theres so many great healthy cafes and smoothie spots in Van now I dont see the point in coming back to here with that type of oversight and customer service Might have to leave you as a memory Bye-da-full wave-emoji
name: Buddha-Full

author: Nina S.
description: I enjoyed everything here and feel great after eating clean but the prices are very high for the portions Value 2/5 Atmosphere 4/5 Service 3/5 Quality 4/5 13/20
name: Buddha-Full

author: Joyce L.
description: I happened upon this cafe while I was in search for Two Daughters whose storefront appeared to be closed There was a sign on the fence indicating they were still accepting special orders so they were definitely still open for business I ran into some ladies who were looking to get pastries at the same shop and they let me know that Buddha-full also sold their goods and walked me there The decor of Buddha-full was super cute I didnt have a chance to Yelp this place prior to going so I wasnt studied up on this cafe I was happy to learn this place was fully vegan and there were just so many sweets and pastries to choose from Since this was a healthier place it appeared most of the sweets were sweetened with dates and natural sweeteners vs straight-up sugar The girl at the register was very helpful in recommending things to try I got the Mango Cheesecake Bar Sunflower Seed Bar and Golden Milk I think thats what it was called Everything was so good I also appreciated not having to pay extra for non-dairy milk Yay The sweets had just a hint of sweetness so they werent overpowering or exhausting Since they were made of whole food ingredients I found them to be quite filling and it took me quite a bit of picking at them throughout the day to finally finish them I wasnt even able to finish them after a hard run at Grouse Grind they were very filling I definitely will come back here the next time Im in Vancouver
name: Buddha-Full

author: Del A.
description: My friends and I decided to visit this spot because we were in the North Van area and had seen pictures of the interior of this place Although we expected it to be more expensive than most places we were shocked to find out that all of their smoothies were 11 While they have a lot of options to choose from and the portion sizes are pretty large I still felt that it was a lot to shell out for a smoothie Regardless I ordered the Green Guru smoothie with cold-pressed apple juice + mango + spinach + pineapple + dates and thought it was good but nothing spectacular The staff is all lovely and friendly as well which is always a plus My favourite part of this café would have to be the interior  its one of the most aesthetic cafes that Ive been to and they even have adorable swings definitely instaworthy That being said I recommend coming once if you want a cute spot to have a smoothie and take shameless pics for the Insta but I probably wouldnt come back a second time given the steep prices
name: Buddha-Full

author: Michelle S.
description: I want to give 3.5 star I ordered rainbow salad and I got a pre-made salad from the fridge It wasnt amazing but decent Wish they made the salad like they did with the bowl my friend ordered Will I come back Maybe
name: Buddha-Full

author: Kaitlyn P.
description: Lovely vegan spot in North Vancouver right in Lower Lonsdale within walking distance to the Quay Great variety on their menu offering juvies lattes smoothies Avis bowls wraps soups salads Buddha bowls and baked goods I had the Ohana Luv Acia bowl and it was good but I noticed all their bowls have the same toppings which is disappointing because they all tasty different but look the same It would be nice if they put in some effort and were slightly different Also I wasnt impressed with the fact that they say bowls will be topped with seasonal fruit yet all I saw on mine was 2 slices of green apple and banana for that reason they get knocked down a star
name: Buddha-Full

author: Mikayla S.
description: Really dont get the hype with this place its not that the food is bad but its fine Its nothing to write home about Most importantly they take SO LONG I was just talking to a friend about this place and she stopped going here because they take so long The procedures set in place for COVID are also not up to par the arrows on the floor are for how to exit and they dont enforce social distancing I ordered two simple smoothies from here about 40 minutes ahead of time When I got there they still werent made I literally got them 30 minutes later Thats simply ridiculous Theyre smoothies Ive worked in the restaurant industry for years this is not how they should function
name: Buddha-Full

author: Kate M.
description: Love the decor and concept but yikes the day I tried this joint for the first time they werent properly staffed and the pricing is too much for what youre getting The woman at the till was clearly in training as she didnt know the product or what she was doing on the till but no one seemed to be taking the time to actually help her out The line up was building behind me quickly and then someone more experience hopped on to show this woman where things were on the iPad and what she needed to do I just asked what teas they had and the more experienced woman wanted this girl in training to take down all the teas from the shelf and let me smell them Although thats nice to do when youve got the time and dont have a pile of people waiting So as she starts taking them down off the shelf I let her know she doesnt need to do that and Ill just have an earl grey and a samosa The samosa was nothing special Ive had a much better veggie samosa elsewhere Indian oven for much cheaper For a plain earl grey tea and a samosa I paid 10 The tea cup was only filled halfway with water too no milk to honey no nothing to make it a little more special than a plain black tea I wouldnt go back here if Im being honest as it left me feeling really underwhelmed
name: Buddha-Full

author: Lara O.
description: I have no complaints Space is beautiful love the communal tables Service was friendly and at a very reasonable pace for how busy it was  Food was delicious and presented so gorgeously I adore their commitment to local suppliers which they list for you to see It is a bit more expensive here but what do people expect for local organic food I for one am happy to support local businesses that support local suppliers and a commitment to organic vegan food My Buddha bowl left me happy and full I couldnt finish it all Hubs had the avo toast and it looked incredible he also said he didnt need anything more
name: Buddha-Full

author: Emily D.
description: This is my first visit Very sad first impression/experience here I placed a pick up order online and paid extra to have a side soup and avocado and tofu in my sandwich I came in to pickup my order very excited to try a new place where I can eat with all my food allergies My order was ready on time and the service was friendly Restaurant has a nice layout and design ascetic I was given my order but had to ask for a takeaway bag odd since it was a  to go order I didnt look inside my take away box because I assumed my order was correct I trusted them When I got home I sat down to open/have my meal and saw a salad Well that was a waste of 3 I decided Id suck that up I went to have the sandwich and then realized the tofu and avocado that I also paid extra for was not included I was SO disappointed I also realized the bread was not gluten free Normally I dont like to complain or write 1 star reviews but after walking in the rain spending 28.88 for a sandwich and latte and feeling a little cheated I decided to call and see if they could remake my order When I called I spoke to the woman who took my name and looked up my order She obviously apologized and said I could have a free pastry next time Im in Thats when I asked about the bread because I was told by a friend who goes here often this was a gluten free restaurant When ordering on their site I saw gluten free vegan organic advertised and assumed it was safe to order Picture attached from website showing misleading info Her reply to me was that people who have gluten issues usually spend more time asking questions and viewing websites I completely understand that was my mistake but what a thing to say when THEIR kitchen staff clearly doesnt read an online take out order That statement really disappointed me and surprised me Since a free pastry wasnt what I wanted I am allergic I asked if they could remake my order Her reply was that the kitchen was closed and there was nothing they could do She asked for my phone number even though it would be on my online order and said the manager would call me tomorrow Since I cannot eat my dinner wasted 28.88 wasted my time and they wont remake my order...what I had WISHED they offered was a refund for the sandwich soup avocado and tofu My latte Im fine to pay for because it was correct and it was yummy Sadly this was not offered to me or mentioned In fact when I asked for this I was told the manager would call I would love to have a good experience here I understand mistakes are made we are only human and restaurants close at 7 PM/people have lives I expect a call from the manager tomorrow and hope I will receive my refund I will update this review with the outcome Really hope I receive a call tomorrow UPDATE never received a follow up
name: Buddha-Full

author: Sangeetha M.
description: Tbh I went to take pictures on the swing The decor is really nice and who doesnt like to sit on swings There are many options for smoothies and it is very overpriced I didnt try the food It took quite some time for the smoothie to be made Overall Id go back to take some nice pictures but wouldnt for the smoothies
name: Buddha-Full

author: Thayssa S.
description: Very healthy food and tasty I love their açai bowl Not done they way Im used to eat but definitely a go when Im home sick
name: Buddha-Full

author: Simon W.
description: The place has got an eat-pray-love vibe to it I ordered their seasonal Buddha bowl for take-out which Im told is an Ahi Poke To my dismay I couldnt find a single trace of Ahi being Japanese for yellowfin tuna in my bowl I dug through the whole thing but was already back at the office so no chance to bring this up with the powers that be Rest of the flavouring was quite nice the highlight being the roasted yams which tasted like roasted yams Im not up to speed on the other trendy ingredients but I do know what tuna looks like when I see it  which I didnt They have an extensive misc home good selection of books candles olive oil and general gifts for the vancouver special They sell Tiffin carriers which Id totally use if I had lunch packed for me everyday  stainless steel just doesnt microwave that well but not to say I wasnt tempted Id just really like some Ahi in my Ahi Poke Is that too much to ask Probably a 4 star if its included I understand that its a vegan place but lets respect the meaning behind words and use them appropriately  Ahi means tuna
name: Buddha-Full

author: Jess S.
description: Yup I love this place Its not huge maybe it is but its soooo busy but you can sit inside or outside Service is extremely excellent considering the amount of people that come and the turn around From the person taking our order to the one making it and they one clearing the dishes every single person was smiling and helpful We ordered the Heart Beet smoothie cold-pressed beet juice + raspberries + strawberries + pineapple pakoras and the GF The Fiesta wrap frijoles de olla + daiya cheese + avocado + tomato + cabbage + chilies Everything is super delicious and incredibly healthy The location is perfect a few blocks from the sea bus and Londsdale Quay We ended up leaving super full and picking up deserts vegan and GF for our brew tour I got the blueberry scone which was hot and moist AF I cant believe its GF Note they do run out of food We were there at 3 and the salad and wrap I wanted were sold out So get there early
name: Buddha-Full

author: Eric B.
description: I loved the artichoke sandwich in a delicious ciabatta Great flavours nice patio in the back
name: The Arbor

author: Nicole G.
description: This restaurant came so highly recommended and I had high hopes The verdict not bad Im committed to eating less meat so am going to be trying many of the vegetarian restaurants on Door Dash I ordered the Fried Oyster Mushrooms which were alright The portion was small for almost 13 pictured Also tried the Caesar Wrap I was intrigued by the fried artichoke but it was also just alright I got it with the vegetarian bacon bits I would order from them again to give em a second chance Am hopeful
name: The Arbor

author: Sofie P.
description: Staff was lovely but was not a fan of my meal at all Ive been here twice now and both time have left disappointed I got the Autumn Harvest Bowl and didnt finish Not what I was expecting That said my friend got the artichoke sandwich and loved it plus they gave her a free dessert for her birthday Not sure this is the place for me but I wish it was
name: The Arbor

author: Chloe C.
description: Dessert was probably the highlight of the meal I really enjoyed the coffee flan and chocolate brownie Tempeh was okay brussel sprouts were meh sunchokes were not it I remember the artichoke sandwich being pretty good might go back to try their burgers
name: The Arbor

author: Manbir R.
description: I was practically dying to have a good vegetarian meal that not only satisfies my apetite but also doesnt make me feel too full Got to the right place i guess I loved what i ate  So we ordered a vegetarian wrap n tofu plus potatoes snack Nicely served and yummy in taste Drinks were many but we had non alcoholic beer n a lemon drink Would go again to try more stuff
name: The Arbor

author: Nicole B.
description: I hate to give a less than satisfactory rating for a local business during our current circumstances but I have to say I was thoroughly disappointed with my take out today I ordered a southern fried vegan sandwich which I have always done The bread was dry I had to send a search party to find the fried artichoke that was buried in a bland mayonnaise sauce under a massive pile of shredded cabbage Its was huge It had no flavour and really skimpy on the artichoke Side note No oyster mushrooms on the current covid menu so wont go back
name: The Arbor

author: Chrissy S.
description: My friend and I went to The Arbor for brunch on a Friday afternoon I loved the casual atmosphere and laid-back vibe The menu is vegetarian comfort food and includes everything from salads to burgers and pasta The drink menu features BC wines along with beer ciders and some signature cocktails They also have many non-alcoholic options We ordered the Cobb Salad and the Southern Fried Artichoke Sandwich Both dishes were delicious and packed with flavor and almost everything is house-made I highly recommend the Fried Artichoke Sandwich The artichokes are battered and fried perfectly and topped with eggplant bacon coleslaw avocado mousse spicy mayo and cheddar cheese If you are in the mood for a cocktail I recommend the Nordic Summer The Arbor patio is a hidden gem on its own If you have the opportunity to sit on the patio  take it They do not take reservations Our server was excellent and the food came out quickly They also took extra measures to make the place COVID-friendly Overall I highly recommend The Arbor and will be back
name: The Arbor

author: Chelsey H.
description: Ive heard of this place but been hesitant to visit because all vegetarian restaurants make me think theyre too hipster and that meals could taste too foragey and green if that makes any sense Oh man the cauliflower island is hands down the most delicious cauliflower Ive ever had Better than Nuba Better than Mamie Taylors GET THIS CAULIFLOWER I was sad we had to share it three ways The fried oysters were super interesting Obviously by oyster they mean oyster mushrooms for a vegetarian place and it was a twist on a vegetarian replacement for kalamari or fried oysters Ive never had them but the sauce was tzaziki-esque Glad I tried them but not my favourite The artichoke sandwich they have is simply delicious The artichoke really tasted meaty without having any meat It was a perfect chicken replacement and the smokey eggplant bacon gave it a perfect southern flavour I did ask for hot sauce because I wanted some spice though their hot sauce is relatively flat That was the only disappointing thing The boy got tomato linguine and in my opinion it wasnt that special It had the foragey-healthy taste I wasnt in the mood for I aint so great with my pasta not having any meat If you arent either Id skip out I know the pinenuts and lemon gremolata were thrown in for texture but I wasnt a fan They had a dessert on special the plum and housemade ricotta A little tart A little funky It was good but nothing to rave about and Id probably skip out on in the future but nice to try The space is extremely cute and whether youre a vegetarian who has never liked meaty textures or a meat eater who just is exploring the vegetarian scene youll definitely find something to enjoy Id recommend going with friends so you can try all the different items if you are feeling like exploring
name: The Arbor

author: Lindsay K.
description: Pros Nice patio Good drinks wine  a non-alcoholic cocktail Good appetizer  lightly fried broccoli called broccoli popcorn although wish it came with a dipping sauce Cons Ordered the burger which itself was just okay The side salad was extremely lame only greens with an oily vinaigrette and the fries were also just okay Pretty disappointed I was craving a good salad and expect a side salad at a veg restaurant to be amazing Service wasnt really great  recognizing it was a busy Saturday night it still could have been better Took especially long to ask for bill Overall a decent evening but was a little disappointed in the food and the service I dont think Ill be going back
name: The Arbor

author: Natalie T.
description: I had been wanting to check out this place for over a year after having great experiences at their sibling restaurant The Acorn which is only a couple of store fronts away I came on a Saturday afternoon for lunch and we luckily beat the afternoon rush Shared the pulled jackfruit steamed buns deep friend oyster mushrooms and the famous artichoke sandwich I had pretty high expectations prior to coming and I felt that this place met my expectations on taste service and value I loved the deep fried oyster mushrooms perfectly seasoned fair portion size nice and crispy The dill dip was so good I felt like it was a really good calamari in terms of flavor and being crisp except it was mushrooms I would definitely order this appetizer again The pulled jackfruit steam buns were interesting flavor was good texture was different but I enjoyed it I am glad I tried it The southern fried artichoke sandwich was really delicious The size was generous and really tasty I dont like artichokes but how they cooked it I didnt care that I wasnt eating meat Service was great servers were efficient and friendly with a laid back vibe I think the food is fairly priced and I was happy with all of the dishes that we ordered I look forward to coming back and trying more off of the menu I would have to say this is my favorite vegetarian restaurant in Vancouver in terms of best taste and value
name: The Arbor

author: Abigail S.
description: The Arbor is a spiffy if tiny veggie haven on Main St with its on-trend white subway tiles and cool modernist sculptures and good smells coming from the kitchen including the likes of fried artichokes and mushrooms pizzas and broccoli popcorn etc A Buddha Bowl/patchouli/burlap kind of vegetarian restaurant it is not Even during the late lunch shift around 2pm on this weekend afternoon the flow of customers was steady and a small wait was necessary Parties larger than 4 might find it a bit too cramped although I hear that the outdoor seating in the summer dramatically expands the capacity The menu really takes meatless cuisine seriously I had the tacos plate which was an extremely filling and tasty composition of batter fried cremini mushrooms slaw poblanos lashed with an avocado crema and cashew creme fraiche assembled in corn tortillas The fried mushrooms acted as the meat supplement and were really delicious Its a personal preference but for my taste there was too much of the cashew cream on top Otherwise I felt satiated long after the meal Our server was just fine and happy to split the group bill up into individual orders without a complaint The fried artichoke sandwich is apparently the crowd favorite and I look forward to returning some day for a go at it
name: The Arbor

author: Deborah H.
description: The fried artichoke sandwich at The Arbor is quite possibly the best sandwich on the face of the earth Full of artichokes cole slaw eggplant bacon Who knew you could make bacon out of eggplant Worth a trip across town to pick up this sandwich for lunch
name: The Arbor

author: Sara B.
description: Great food Wonderful service Beautiful back patio Love the harvest bowl Ive been here many times in the last few years and never been disappointed Grabbed take out tonight to support one of my favourite local restaurants in this awful time Thanks Paul
name: The Arbor

author: Imma M.
description: Visit the Arbor if you feel like getting yelled at by a server My spouse and I attended the Arbor to purchase a gift card or gift certificate for a friend We like the food at the Arbor and because we live nearby we find ourselves there once a month or so often brining along friends or family Today when we approached the counter I started to request information about a gift card or gift certificate I began to say Hi would it be possible to before I was rudely cut off by the man at the desk He raised his voice interrupting me mid-sentence to say Ill be with you in a minute Needless to say my spouse and I were put off enough that we left and will not be returning With his condescending and unfriendly behavior the staffperson at the front counter not only lost our business tonight in terms of the gift card we hoped to buy but our business in the future and the business of our friends for whom we were buying the gift card It wouldnt have bothered me to wait a few minutes while he finished whatever he was doing he was not serving another customer or on the phone when I approached the counter Unfortunately he didnt even have the patience to let me finish my sentence The Arbor is becoming widely known for good food and bad service This is not the first time weve had an experience like this at the Arbor and we intend to take our business somewhere that were treated with a modicum of respect I tried to post on their Instagram account about my experience and they blocked me Worst service Ive ever experienced in Vancouver Do yourself a favor and stay home
name: The Arbor

author: Steve V.
description: The Arbor is in a space that has held some great restaurants and some really crappy short-lived ones in between I feel the Arbor is a good fit and theyve done it justice to make it hip and approachable The food is good As these kinds of places tend to go you have to accept the they higher cost of the ingredients not being bought from Costco and Vancouver rents are passed on to you so dont be shocked by small portion size I liked what we ate and would go back if i wasnt loking to really fill a big hunger void My family being people in their 40s-80s all liked it too so that tells you something One thing Ive sort of notice in non-meat establishments is the seeming need to fry everything to bridge the gap between veg and meat As of late I havent easily been able to equate eating vegetarian to eating healthy and I did find that a bit here
name: The Arbor

author: Nicole M.
description: Accidentally stumbled onto this patio while on a desperate search for a stroller-friendly place to have a glass of wine in our new neighborhood Was even happier when I learned their happy hour started at 3pm Staff was friendly and accommodating while I waited for my husband to join Didnt realize it was a vegetarian place until my husband pointed it out I tried the jackfruit steam buns and they were a delicious treat Ill be back to explore more of their menu soon
name: The Arbor

author: Sarah M.
description: The artichoke sandwich is a blissful experience like no other I wish I could eat it at least several times a week I get it with the hazelnut cheese which is truly delectable Very few times in my life have I felt so deeply passionate about 2 pieces of bread with stuff in the middle but wowee This is really something else Long live the artichoke long live the Arbor
name: The Arbor

author: Graham M.
description: My boyfriend and I used to really like this place and their food is quite good but the last time we went he wanted his burger without the mayo-like special sauce as he cant really tolerate mayo or anything like it The server sheepishly informed us that while theyd been able to negotiate that with the kitchen this time they couldnt really guarantee it going forward I guess making something my boyfriend can eat compromises their artistic vision We havent been back since and I dont see that changing unless they get things under control
name: The Arbor

author: Bunny L.
description: It was my first time in the Arbor I did not even know they have a lovely garden in the back The Caesar salad came out quickly Good portion and tasty Thumbs up
name: The Arbor

author: Sara A.
description: Wow this is definitely my new favourite vegetarian restaurant in town We have the following Tacos  layers of flavours Love it Jackfruit Buns  so flavourful Burger with Eggplant Bacon  the texture is amazing Chocolate Mousse  decadent Peppermint Tea  even the tea is nice  strong The service was friendly and welcoming
name: The Arbor

author: Cherry L.
description: I am a long time customer of CHAU and enjoy their food and drinks Their items are usually always great however I am very disappointed with their execution this time Included is a photo of the coconut shake which I requested for it to be no ice because it was a very cold night This is unacceptable behaviour from a restaurant I know of no other place that under-fills their drinks like this due to a no ice request If this is the case I think they should list the amount of ml on their menu to let the customers know the exact amount they are purchasing Or at least inform the customer at point-of-purchase I am actually already very surprised that I found one piece of coconut meat in this takeout drink because Ive received this drink multiple times without a single piece of coconut meat when I get it to go they usually put two pieces when you order for dine in For a drink that is charged at 6.25 plus taxes I am very disappointed in the amount that was given It is barely half full Overall the taste of food and drinks is great but I am very disappointed in the restaurants execution and inconsistency
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Marc L.
description: just a lovely place to be and the food is very carefully prepared clean nice patio fun staff
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Thu N.
description: The menu is diverse with different types of vegetarian dishes compared to other vegetarian restaurants The food is mixture of Vietnamese  Western styles and tastes so good The space is a little small and more suitable for small group gathering  under 5 people
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Van F.
description: Today I witnessed a couple of losers harassing the Victoria Street staff for upholding mask/passport policy So unfair You guys are doing a great job keeping yourselves and community safe by following provincially mandated health orders My lunch was delicious
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Domenic P.
description: The golden temple soup has healing powers I truly believe it is the best soup Ive had It is named after the famed abode of god a chromed out holy architecture that looks like a wet dream of Salvador Dali who was once quoted saying I dont do drugs I am drugs Which is what this soup is drugs You crave it and it makes you feel better The song Love Is Only A Feeling came on through the speakers after It was placed on my table On this particular day I didnt have plans of coming here but the guy in front of me was turning left and it took me until right now to realize that was no ordinary man that was my spirit guide Woscar that lead me to this soup Please consider offering bibs as my white shirt now has many turmeric stains
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Marina B.
description: I absolutely love Chau I cant believe that for years I held off trying it because I was under the false belief that I wouldnt feel fully satisfied with it being vegan I finally tried it one evening with a vegan friend and boy was I wrong The moment the golden temple broth touched my lips I was hooked Ive been coming here regularly ever since Even my meat-loving boyfriend loves it Im so obsessed with the golden-temple soup that I cant not order it every single time My favourite way to have it is with the quinoa which sounds like its going to be too healthy tasting but it just compliments the soup so well The texture of the quinoa is so nice in the soup and it doesnt really absorb the broth too much I also like to get extra veggies between my boyfriend and I we get one order of extra regular veggies broccoli cauliflower carrot and one extra order of yams The extra veggies makes it all the more hearty and I always have leftovers Even though I always get the golden temple Ive tried lots of other things too Everything so far has been delicious Ive tried the diving for pearls soup  which is really tasty the fresh rolls the tempeh one is my absolute favourite the baisou chips must get the coconut shake so yummy must try and the peanut bar you absolutely must get this The ice cream is also really yummy my favourite is the green goodness I dont usually like vegan ice cream but this is so delish Chau is a great place for a quick casual healthy bite for vegans and non-vegans a like The service is always friendly and prompt and the food is always delicious and consistent It also a great place for takeout which is especially important in these times I find in a lot of other restaurants the food either doesnt take out well or you end up getting screwed on the portion size or preparation So Its really nice to find a restaurant where you know you are going to be equally satisfied when choosing takeout and never have to worry about feeling ripped off Im sure Ill be back again next week for my favourite golden temple soup
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Jay K.
description: they let me come in wait in line for 10 min then once i started ordering takeout told me i cannot order without a vaccine passport i did show my vaccination card and was wearing a mask they couldnt accept my order by phone either because it wasnt working ive been a loyal customer ordering at least weekly for the last two years and im not going back
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Sydney K.
description: Just moved to Vancouver and was recommended this place to eat by a friend and it did not disappoint Im vegan myself however I was with my omnivore parents and they were also blown away by how amazing the food was Came here twice and tried different dishes and all of them were astounding Will definitely be my go to place for a meal out
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Patricia F.
description: I love this place You wont miss meat here My boyfriend is a self professed meat eater and he regularly suggests grabbing dinner from here which is a huge statement Theyve recently knocked down the wall that seperates the spaces and makes the place feel bigger For Covid measures they have stickers on the ground for you to wait to order Plastic barriers have been set up on tables as well For the food I have never had anything not 100% delicious here My favourite is the Golden Temple Bowl which is creamy from coconut milk and packed with flavour The rickety Rick shaw noodle bowl is also very delicious The tarp chips come with an interesting dip At first you may think its a peanut dressing of sorts but once you taste it its very different Definitely recommend this place on any day
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Glen M.
description: OMGawda I left this place full as a tick First off its a very popular restaurant along Victoria st 10 minutes after we sat down it was packed Every table filled including counter space so get there early or prepare to wait IF you do have to wait the wait is worth it Cute place All veggie Cant go wrong Well the food  to start we had two different kinds of delicious spring rolls which were very good and these amazing tarot I think thats what they were chips with a dip that was awesome So good And my main meal was the very good Golden Temple something soup that was in a delicious coconut broth with tons of veggies incl a couple veggies Ive never tried before all in a massive bowl Just know youll get fed well and itll be delicious You should try this place
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Ly W.
description: Ive tried coming to this restaurant twice and both times it was packed I finally got to try this restaurant today and was excited to see what the hype was about Honestly it wasnt really anything special or spectacular You order at the front and find a seat and food is served to you The servers were great The ladies were so friendly and came by to collect our dishes even though its half self served and asked if everything was okay We didnt find the gentleman at the cashier the owner very friendly No smile or friendly conversation or thank yous when we went up to order Prices are around 11-14 and portion is decent BUT I wasnt full when we left I ordered the Rickety Rickshaw and it is like a normal Vietnamese vermicelli bowl but without meat It had carrots cucumber radish bean sprouts bean curd and four spring roll bites While the ingredients were fresh I found the dish very ordinary The spring rolls were hard like slightly stale and I found the proportion was a little off I was done the spring rolls and was left with a lot of noodles and veggies My bf ordered the Tropical Rainstorm and the coconut was overwhelming If you like coconut then you would like this dish My bf didnt like it because it was on the sweet side and tasted kind of like dessert We also tried the thai milk tea and coconut pandan icecreams We liked how the icecreams werent very sweet but the flavour was light The coconut pandan icecream was quite delightful but I couldnt taste the Thai milk tea flavour for the Thai milk tea icecream Would we come back Probably not If we were craving vegan or vegetarian dishes we prefer the MeeT restaurants because their dishes are flavour bombs
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Elvi R.
description: Ive been here multiple times and have ordered pretty much the same thing every time We love the Namaste Fresh Rolls  Nonla Crispy Rolls We order these to start every single time we go For the main I really enjoy the Midnight Swim Bowl with thick rice noodles Its super flavourful ans a little spicy Very delicious We also enjoy the Golden Temple Soup when its a rainy day The Baisao Beach Chips with the tofu dip is great to grab and have as a snack later on
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Masaki F.
description: It was pretty good before but now all potions got smaller and the taste didnt same at all of course the price was higher disappointed but I guess time goes by
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Sayoka H.
description: Been a big supporter of CHAU Veggie since their open Never once have I had a terrible experience and the food is delicious My got to is their golden temple soup with a side bowl of rice My goodness bowl of hot soup on a crispy cold Vancouver day is heaven in my mouth Portions are on the bigger side but hey you get your moneys worth Their Taro chips are delicious I would kill to have the sauce at home with veggie snacks as well I am not a vegetarian but have grown a lot of love for this place Definitely support your local business as much as possible this one is my pick
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Max L.
description: Love Golden Temple soup with quinoa and Namahata rolls Always fresh and great customer service Highly recommended
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Colene C.
description: This place makes healthy eating easy Whether its their yummy tarp chips and addicting dip or their noodle bowls I always feel so satiated when Im eating here Even better its made with fresh ingredients so I dont have to feel guilty My go-to favourites are the taro chips the rickety rickshaw bowl and the golden temple soup The golden temple soup in particular has this rich curry broth that is great for the veggies to soak up the flavour You have a choice of rice or noodles but my fave is the noodles The only slight downside is how popular this place is You order first at the counter then find a place to sit Communal and bar seating But I love the food here so much its worth it Pro-tip they have a location on Granville Island Great to get take out and sit by the water
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Cherise B.
description: This was our first visit and it wont be our last Oh my goodness the food is delicious and so fresh We had the Golden Temple Soup  everything everyone says in the reviews is true Its just perfect Im so happy we ordered two so I have left overs for tomorrow We also loved the Namaste rolls Nonla Crispy rolls and the Chocolate Peanut butter bar  WOW Were so excited to try more dishes and also get all of these items again And to top it off the customer service is amazing Highly recommend
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Michelle W.
description: Ive been trying to cut down on my meat intake lately so it was about time to CHAU down on some veggies I was a bit confused walking in as I didnt know that you had to pay first and seat yourself Water and condiments are also self-serve While I do prefer paying after my main issue was in regard to the tables as they werent wiped down after customers left Our table fell victim to this as it had a sticky residue and some crumbs As I wasnt too hungry I only ordered a Namaste Fresh Roll 5.50 and had a bit of the Golden Temple Soup 14.25 The Namaste Fresh Roll was pho-nomenal Having recently had one across the stress this roll knocked the other out of the water Absent of meat this rolls flavour is fully embodied in the lemongrass steamed tofu mung beans crispy shallots and wheat centre and roasted peanut sauce among other ingredients I certainly have to highlight this sauce because it was thiccc and had actual peanuts in it Of course I smothered my roll in it down to the last drop In other words order this dish For the meager amount of the Golden Temple Soup that I tried it packed quite the punch The aroma of the turmeric coconut curry was intoxicating and only surpassed by its rich complex flavour This and the Rice Fields Bowl appear to be the largest in portion size and are the most expensive but neither dish seems like it will leave you feeling too bloated While I enjoyed the rice noodles and the beancurd I didnt care much for the taro which was too large and dense for my liking It was the only point in the meal where I missed the succulent bite of meat say a beef brisket It was my first time eating at this location and I fully intend on sampling more of the menu to write a more fulsome review When I went to the Granville Island location I had the Rickety Rickshaw and it was pretty good from what I remember though Id imagine the portion size is smaller than this locations Next up for me will be the Rice Fields Bowl and the Namahata Fresh Rolls Until then CHAU for now
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Sunny T.
description: Staff were friendly and all covid measures were in place The coconut drink really blew me away
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Sandra W.
description: Wonderfully surprised I wish I could eat here everyday I love their nutritious green smoothies and yummy menu after a long day of hiking and tennis Was beautifully plated and safe measures were taken and luckily wasnt too busy We sat outside on the patio and the service was great
name: CHAU Veggie Express

author: Ben R.
description: Always such good food service presentation and overall experience Couldnt recommend this restaurant enough
name: Sula

author: Jennie Y.
description: We had a lovely dinner here last week The chatpata sev puri crispy wheat papdi stuffed with chaat topped with spicy potato sev was amazing and packed with flavour The butter chicken and lamb curries were also great Their garlic naan was fried perfectly extra crispy on the outside but still fluffy on the inside We sat inside and felt like we were transported to a tropical island with the open air windows high ceilings and eclectic decor
name: Sula

author: Jurn L.
description: I absolutely love Indian food but unfortunately I dont get to eat it as much as I want to because fiancé isnt much of a fan So I was super happy to check out Sula with a girlfriend as it came highly recommended by our mutual girlfriend Between the two of us we shared the Butter Chicken and Gobi Aloo along with Garlic Naan for me and Tandoori Naan for her Everything was super delicious We chose a Medium spicy level for the Butter Chicken and it had the perfect kick to it The Naans came out warm and fresh The Gobi Aloo tasted great as well We had enough leftovers for dinner Overall it was a yummy lunch Also received great service Highly recommend
name: Sula

author: Lyndsay P.
description: Truth be told Ive eaten out far more than my reviews point to...Covid is exhausting and it hasnt been top of mind BUT this place I only popped in for a happy hour snack and drink I will return for the full menu that looks amazing The snacks were so yummy but the best part about this place was the warm and welcoming atmosphere The servers were so incredibly kind I havent had service like it for as long as I can remember Just felt like I was visiting someones home Comfortable with hosts that were attentive and just so genuine Will return for a full meal and will update then too
name: Sula

author: Aerica W.
description: Love the interior here and even their cutlery cups/glasses were beautiful Staff were super friendly and accommodating Nice and cozy place for drinks and conversations 1 oz for 7 and 2 oz for 10 Came here for their Happy Hour menu drinks I came here on a Saturday Sat  Sun Happy Hour 2-5pm weekday hours vary I believe roughly 3pm or 4pm to 6pm Our order Indian Summer tequila pomegranate pink salt lime Unique and tasty drink as I dont see pomegranate drinks often or ever anywhere else Western Ghats vodka cherry lemonade sparkling water  Im personally not a fan of cherry but my friend said it was delicious and refreshing with the added bubbles from the sparkling water Nagpur orange grapefruit soda lime  I really enjoyed this one it has a neat citrus-y blend with a kick Tandoori Wings 9 super flavourful and juicy wings with a tasty charred flavourful Highly recommend this  Beautifully presented drinks that pack a punch Might as well 2 oz everything Also tried their chaat savoury snacks on a separate visit which are popular and typically served at road-side stalls or food cars in India My order Samosa Chaat the samosas were HUGE and very very filling so I would recommend sharing if youd like to try other dishes Spiced potatoes onions and peas are stuffed in a savoury pastry Its also loaded with a lot of toppings house-made chutneys sauces Indian yogurt and my personal favourite which were these crunchy mini-sticks on top sorry I dont know the name of it Sev Puri wheat balls w various fillings Hollow crunchy wheat balls which already taste great by themselves and are filled with a bunch of stuff as well including chickpeas onions cilantro pomegranate etc Highly addictive bited-sized and vegan Vada Pav fried potato dumpling in bread The bun is amazing its toasted on butter and has a great chewy texture The fried potato dumpling tastes like a mini samosa to me Also very filling Overall everything was very flavourful This restaurant definitely pays attention to details  their food flavours decor service everything
name: Sula

author: Marci H.
description: Very warm and inviting room excellent service and amazing quality food The cocktails are creative and delicious the prices are reasonable Will definitely be back again and again
name: Sula

author: Krista R.
description: The service and quality of dining at Sula is fantastic I love all their dishes but what makes them unique is their Indian street food the Railway is a family favourite dont miss out
name: Sula

author: Matt B.
description: Really happy to see a second Sula location this one even closer to home And for them to open during the pandemic they must be doing really well We ordered takeout one evening and went to pick up the food when ready 45 mins later Menu is nearly identical to the original location with an exclusive vegan section of items I am happy to report theyve replicated the original location in terms of the awesomeness of the food We ordered the veg jalfrezi gobi aloo and the bhindi okra all medium-hot which was perfect spice level might be a bit much for some  as well as a couple tandoori rotis ask for no butter to ensure its vegan Total 53 after tax which is a little spendy for Indian food but totally worth it for the high-quality of the food  and we had enough for one for meal the next day Wonderfully complex flavours not too oily rich without being overwhelming and generous portions And their dishes have loads of veggies and arent too saucey or thin like many Indian places Overall Sula remains our favourite Indian restaurant in Vancouver Top recommendation
name: Sula

author: Jeannie Y.
description: Flavours in Sula is better than the previous restaurant I had samosa chat and cheese and garlic naan The samosa was just lightly warm I was hoping for fresh piping hot and crispy I also hoped it be spicier However I did enjoy the varied texture profiles between the chick peasfrom the sauce and the topping of thin red onion slices  Also enjoyed the sweetish/sour/salty flavour notes all in one dish The garlic and cheese naan was yummy I bought butter chicken to take home I asked for spucy level just a bit above medium Although flavorful I received mild to medium spiciness Id ssy the ambiance and staff were courteous I would go back again
name: Sula

author: Michael L.
description: Came here during Dine Out Vancouver during COVID I reviewed their web page prior to booking and it was nice to see the COVID protocols they had in place including temperature checks on patrons When we arrived they did not do the temperature checks on us nor on any of the other patrons that followed They have installed large plexiglass screens between tables for COVID protection and all the staff wore masks I was satisfied with the COVID compliance so now onto the review The room is beautifully re-done from the old Reef restaurant that used to occupy the space for the past 21 yrs We ordered off the Dine Out Vancouver menu 30 per person knowing that this would be a lot of food we were not disappointed We ordered the spinach potato onion pakora and the chicken tenders as appetizers Both were great tasting and both were large portions For the main I ordered the chicken tikka masala hot spice level coconut rice and the naan The dishes came out in beautiful dishes and again the taste of each were great The naan was sooo good and they did not hold anything back on the hot spice level I barely got into the main before I was full...again nice large portion size For dessert we sampled the mango coconut rice pudding and the almond pistachio rasmalai cheesecake These were nice refreshing desserts after such a large meal They provided us take out containers and we left with meals for 2 persons The service was exceptional I liked that they brought a large pitcher of water and left it on the table for patrons to fill their glasses We had a chance to meet the owner and he explained how he selected this location trying to find an area with no Indian establishments in close proximity Sula is a welcome addition to the Main St  Mt Pleasant restaurant scene It was a very positive food experience and I am happy to recommend Sula if looking for Indian food in the area
name: Sula

author: Eileen R.
description: Delicious A great place to satisfy your taste buds Im going back Butter chicken with garlic naan and a dish from the chaat menu Im going back to try more
name: Sula

author: Regina P.
description: The food was presented very nicely but not as tasty as expected The service was quick but when I tried to add a seat to our reservation and requested for inside dining they told me they were completely booked up So we were stuck in a little corner on the patio while there were plenty of seats inside that would have accommodated 1 more person I think for this reason wont be back
name: Sula

author: Chloe C.
description: Somewhat expensive but decent portions Food tasted fresh Channa Saag 4.5/5 Asked for mild but was more like mild-medium Very flavourful with lots of chickpeas I enjoyed this Bhagare Bhaigan 4/5 Asked for mild but this one wasnt spicy at all unlike the Channa Saag which is strange Sauce is tomato based and was nice although I wasnt a fan of the grated coconut on top Baby eggplants were nice and tender but I still prefer regular eggplant Eggplant Bharta is my favourite and Bhagare Bhaigan doesnt come close has nothing to do with the restaurant
name: Sula

author: Danny K.
description: What an excellent new addition to the Vancouver ethnic restaurant scene A mixture of delicious Indian curries and street food In particular the dhai puri was amazing as was the saag paneer In addition excellent service thanks Mithu food handling and atmosphere Only minor thing if any is the food lacked a bit of depth of flavor that you often find at classic Indian restaurants May be the result of catering to a more North American pallet Overall amazing and well definitely be visiting again and taking our friends
name: Sula

author: Aditya G.
description: Our server was great The ambience is very good But thats it  it was all downhill from there The girl at the front was really not in the mood to be there and behaved as if she was tired and pissed The food is the main disappointment  this is not Indian cuisine This is what these people think is Indian cuisine and their interpretation is way way way off the mark I cant even call this whitewashed food because it was just tasteless garbage with good plating
name: Sula

author: Yuka T.
description: I visited this restaurant because I wanted to try Indian curry It was very delicious The naan had a nice garlic flavor that matched the curry very well I had a chicken curry milder it was good because it had a rich flavor Also the waitresses were cheerful and made the meal enjoyable
name: Sula

author: Jerome D.
description: This was a fantastic dining experience  it starts with extremely friendly staff  great atmosphere and a lovely fire in the stove keeping the restaurant warm on a cold  wet day  our server was also excellent  suggesting food to try  and all was very tasty satisfying and beautifully presented will definitely recommend and return
name: Sula

author: Nye M.
description: Ordered the portobello mushroom appetizer Asked specifically that it not be spicy It was spicy The server then began to explain why they dont ask for spice levels with appetizers as they come as they are Would have preferred she tell me that as I ordered it not when she checked in with us after we took a few bites Their Instagram page makes the food look amazing Its doesnt quite look like that in person Frankly overpriced for what it is
name: Sula

author: Jack D.
description: Incredible laid back service with delicious and authentic dishes Great patio good music and lots of unique cocktails Must try Dahi Puri
name: Sula

author: Chris P.
description: Drove into Vancouver heading to an Asian restaurant it was marked Open but when we arrived it was closed due to Family Day We were so hungry we checked out what else was close by Sula had great reviews so headed there We were greeted by a pleasant waitress name Katika  hope I got the spelling correct I asked for her recommendations and they were absolutely delicious The food matched the service My only suggestion for the restaurant is to serve filtered water as the water had a lot of chlorine
name: Sula

author: Annika G.
description: 4.5/5 so good while we visited vancouver this was our favorite spot woweeee the spring rolls were so good even my BF who isnt really a fan of vegetarian food usually was caught off guard by how delicious everything was the service was smooth and friendly the ambience of the restaurant was really nice  the decorations and the overall restaurant was beautiful we got there at a good time around 11:30AM not long after it opened and luckily we did so as it got so busy as were finishing up so make sure to come early while there we tried the charcoal lemonade spring rolls papaya salad and lettuce wraps we only tried from the appetizers as we werent too interested in the entrees but man were we satisfied and full from the 3 appetizers each was was delicious and did not feel heavy i felt super healthy after eating all of it the charcoal lemonade was very interesting it did not stain our teeth and tasted like an earthy lemonade that was not too sour moreover it tasted even fresher with mint leaves that i borrowed from our appetizers i usually dont like eating out but this spot i would love to return to
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Emma W.
description: Wow I am so happy my friend recommended this new spot during my recent visit home to Vancouver Do Chay Yaletown is a beautiful and hip spot equipped with hanging plants serving up healthy and clean Vietnamese dishes and cocktails We stopped by at 11:30am on a Friday and were the first people there we made a reservation just in case They have great seating options inside and out My friend and I shared the mango salad black truffle tofu and eggplant dish Everything was delicious but the tofu was definitely our fave It was perfectly crisp and the sauce it came with was perfectly light and flavored without being overwhelming We also got black lemonades which was a wonderful accompaniment to the meal I will definitely be back
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Elvi R.
description: Decided to go to Do Chay in Yaletown for Mothers Day dinner Everything we ordered was delicious We started with the spring rolls and the wings I can probably have 10 orders of the wings Theyre so good super crispy and I love the sweet and spicy sauce that theyre coated in Before becoming vegan lemongrass beef was a go to for me so I was super excited to try their lemongrass tofu Loved the crispy shallots on top Was very flavourful I would order it again It was a very generous portion We also ordered the Bún Bò Huế but got it with rice noodles instead of the spaghetti looking noodles It was very flavourful and very spicy in my opinion The waitress said it wasnt but it definitely warmed me up The kind is spicy you want to keep eating I went back last weekend and was so happy again Definitely recommend this place if you like Vietnamese food Bon Appétit
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Siimmy G.
description: Amazing Vegan/Vegetarian cuisine in YT We tried four different vegan dishes and the flavour was amazing The vegan chicken wings made from mushrooms were definitely my fav and apparently the most popular The menu does change quite a bit I was told so Ill def be back
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Jacqueline W.
description: So amazing I cant back the very next day Theres a reason why this place won best new restaurant 2020 You wing miss meat eating here Everything is so flavourful The spring rolls are crispy yet not oily The fish sauce it comes with makes the dish come together so well Also tried the black garlic braised eggplant Absolutely delicious I love eggplant now 10/10 on all dishes
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Be F.
description: We stumbled on this place while trying to find Meet and ended up having a way better meal We had the Prosperity Dumplings  complex tender and flavourful in a lovely broth the pho  very authentic with the surprising win of avocado slices and tofu skin and Uncle Hings Wings breaded oyster mushrooms with a sweet sauce Fabu Wed order all three again but want to come back and try everything else first starting with the lemongrass tofu and the vegan Vern
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Cy W.
description: Delicious food that is kind to the environment We have been a fan of the restaurants Kingsway location so we are excited that it opened a second location right in the heart of Yaletown which is in need of a place offering delicious and inventive vegetarian food We were looking for a light meal and decided to go Do Chay for some healthy dinner For appetizer we were curious about the Uncle Hings Wings which are deep fried breaded mushrooms in a sticky sweet and sour sauce It definitely taste very similar to chicken wings We also got the Spring Rolls which comes with mustard green cut into perfect wrapping shape and herb basil/sage For entrees we shared the Black Garlic Eggplant served with yo choy and rice We cant wait to go back and try out all the other creative vegetarian dishes they have on the menu
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Charly S.
description: Spring rolls served with greens for wrapping and Black Garlic Eggplant/Tofu  these are two of my all-time favourite foods The spring rolls are crispy outside and chewy inside  wrap in the accompanying greens and dip  soooo delicious just like Vietnam The Black Garlic Eggplant and tofu is a savoury sweet smokey dish served with perfectly cooked fluffy rice and a few greens is Vietnamese comfort food perfect for cold wet Vancouver nights The mango salad is delicious but I prefer these types of salads a little crunchier/less soft The Pho is the best vegan pho Ive had  rich yet smooth and clean filling and colourful This Yaletown location is bright and cheery nice patio out front If youre looking for plant based Vietnamese look no further Enjoy
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Chloe C.
description: This is my dads new favourite vegan spot The food was so delicious but the portions were definitely small for the price The decor is really amazing though Uncle Hings Wings 5/5 This was the best deep fried mushroom dish Ive ever had We all couldnt stop raving about it The batter is crispy and not greasy and the mushrooms had a great texture The flavour was the perfect balance of sweet and spicy Black Garlic Eggplant 5/5 This was so flavourful The eggplant and tofu was cooked perfectly and the sauce was amazing The textures and flavours were on point Satay Noodles 5/5 The broth was really good and I loved the crispiness of the seitan The noodles were nice and chewy and there was a lot of vegetables I wish there was slightly more seitan but we all loved this dish nonetheless Curry Bowl 4/5 This was good but it was served lukewarm I wish there was more curry but the pumpkin croquette things were really interesting as they were chewy and had a nice mild flavour The potatoes were very undercooked though and the eggplant also could have been more tender The curry was quite chunky and it could have been more liquid in my opinion but overall it was still very enjoyable I definitely recommend this place It has the best vegan Vietnamese food in Vancouver and a great place to go for date night or if you are looking to splurge a little
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Dave S.
