description: Wait wasnt bad When I arrived with my wife they had seating for 2 inside and all the tables outside were open It wasnt that cold so we sat outside and the bartender was kind enough to start the heater for us We waited about 10 minutes to get our order in  just two bowls In the mean time after we had ordered another table of 3 came and sat down We were told 15 minutes later they are a little backed up so itll be a few more minutes 10 minutes later my wifes bowl arrived My wife finished her bowl and during this the table that arrived after us got 5 different plates of theirs before I got my one bowl I told the waitress this is odd but all I was told was they were backed up Food wasnt worth the hype but just okay
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Emy P.
description: We were so excited to try this new spot in Van Everything was alright until we discovered a dark hair inside one of the tofu piece Daikon Cakes we had ordered 2 nights ago This is unacceptable especially with the current situation the world lives in Everything else was delicious and its too bad they cant control their food better
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Angela W.
description: I have been wanting to try this for a while but Kingsway location is out of the way for me Im so glad they open in Yaletown Interior is very chic and clean gives a nice comfy vibe Food was great both taste and visual-wise and satisfying even though theres no meat we had 5 appetizers and 1 main shared among 3 of us small to medium tummies and it was just right I loved all of them except maybe the Black Truffle Tofu which doesnt have much of a truffle taste but has strong ginger taste which I hate but my parents liked it The Black Garlic Eggplant was excellent though the rice was a little too mushy for my taste the eggplant was egg-cellent though Pricing reasonable and service good Will definitely revisit soon to try rest of the menu
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Matt B.
description: Very happy to see this place open a second location replacing House Special Everything about the original location is copied well here with the addition of a very pleasant patio out front overlooking this quiet part of Hamilton Menu is a bit smaller than the Kingsway location but they have all the staples here I ordered takeout for lunch here with a friend we ordered the black garlic eggplant and the vegan pho both exceptional and both 15 Very generous portions too for reasonable prices especially for Yaletown The order was ready in 20 minutes and everything was perfect Great to see this gem of a place expand
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Amir A.
description: We did a review on this restaurant on our show We loved it The food is great https://youtu.be/likL-SZPNzw
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Roger D.
description: Even if you are not a vegan this place is delicious Food is fresh and simply fantastic I have been here several times and Im always impressed Remember that Thursday night is busy in Yaletown
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: C B.
description: Good space cool decor but Cmon Seriously Gluten free vegan vegetarian Trendy empty vague premises that suck a tiny % of the community in for an empty food experience at a grossly inflated price Went there tonight with a friend so sad A dish titled Uncle Hings wings 5 mushrooms pieces deep fried tossed with the usual sad suspects so boring If your ridiculous sales and marketing pitch is vague vegan and boring why not have a protein name based dish  Lets have Turkey Tofu or a plant hot dog as well Looking at the menu basic 9 ingredients done 19 ways All our dishes lacked taste texture the Vegan pho was miserable maybe rename  Pathetic Pho   Or just say left over veggies thrown in a bowl Would never go back
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Angelina C.
description: First time at this place and I was not disappointed We go the uncle hings wings satay noodles and black garlic eggplant The wings were definitely my favorite The soup has a good potential but it came out warm so I wasnt able to enjoy it to the fullest Overall the restaurant itself is very welcoming and the all of the staff is very polite Well definitely be back
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Amy C.
description: I loved their first location and am so happy they opened a second The Yaletown location is spacious with great outdoor seating You got to get the salad rolls  THEY ARE AMAZING The Vegan verm is absolutely delicious I like the pho but found the entire avocado a bit too much I asked to sub the avocado for more bean curd instead
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Tommy D.
description: Food is good but the service is incredibly slow Make sure youre not hungry when you go there because you will be extremely hangry Have dined in and ordered for pick up and both times waited over 30 minutes for the order
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Pankti P.
description: Food is amazing and service is fast too Highly recommended for vegetarian lovers Please reserve your spot before going otherwise wait bit longer during peak time Overall great food and good experience
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Becky T.
description: Got the vegetarian pho and it was delicious  Broth was super flavorful included lots of veggies and some tofu and mock meat It was very filling  Service was also amazing and the tea served with the meal was also very good
name: Veggiebowl

author: Jonny M.
description: I wanted BBH for lunch but the lineup was ridiculous at Cafe Xu Hue We ventured two doors down to Veggiebowl where there was plenty of room They specialize in Vietnamese vegetarian food We dropped in on a Sunday for a late lunch around 1:00pm Theres 8 tables 3 booths and room for about 32 people Service is standard the front is run by the kids At least our teas were refilled several times Menu is short and sweet with only 15 items appetizers rice  noodles and beverages They had a few desserts only available on the weekends on the counter and in the fridge che  Hu tieu nam vang B5 10.50  tapioca noodles broth fried vegan ham cube assorted tofu enoki mushrooms cauliflower and carrots Never seen this offered before so had to try it The tapioca glass noodles were enjoyable Broth was clean slightly peppery Fried vegan ham cube was a solid meat replacement Good variety of vegetables seems like they change it up depending on availability  Hu tieu satay B7 10.50  flat rice noodles peanut satay sauce shallots fried tofu beansprouts mushrooms cucumber lettuce tomatoes basil and roasted peanuts Didnt realize this was a dry noodle dish when we ordered it Sauce had some good heat to it but it was thin almost too watery Decent but nothing spectacular Decent vegetarian food but nothing Im craving
name: Veggiebowl

author: C.S J.
description: If you dont need the trendy cachet of places like Do Chay Veggie Bowl is infinitely better with deeply flavourful broths good value timely accurate service and wide selection Have not been disappointed with anything Ive tried and only want to try everything
name: Veggiebowl

author: Gavin W.
description: Unpretentious son of a gun this place is Dont expect to see hipsters or westsiders clad in yoga outfits here Do expect good food for those who are vegetarians or vegans as many of the dishes are available dairy-free and especially for those who like me generally eschew red meats but who from time to time need to sink their teeth into something with some modicum of protein-y texture When that urge strikes the go-to dish is the Lemongrass Tofu The deep-fried component can be somewhat dry even with the fish sauce See my picture Otherwise its pretty damn good My daughter likes the Vegetarian Curry with brown rice Very tasty and rich broth My son likes the Spring Rolls The skin has a solid crunch to it Its no small feat to create these flavors without dipping deeply or at all into the animal kingdom  Ive dined here maybe seven times Seating has not been a problem You can usually find parking on Kingsway if you get here at around 6:00pm Décor is functional See p
name: Veggiebowl

author: Annie M.
description: Veggiebowl is located on Kingsway between Gladstone and Baldwin Street Its small and clean Vietnamese vegetarian restaurant I came here for dinner with my Buddhist good friend She has to go for vegan meal on 1st and 15th each month My friend recommended few good dishes to me Its quite impressed Bue Hue  Tofu bean curd enoki and king oyster mushrooms and lotus root Great and simple ingredients in lemongrass spiced broth SO delicious for spicy vegetarian noodle bowl Bi Cuon  Shredded tofu rolls its good and filling Goi Ngo Sen  Lotus salad so refresh Bang cuon and Ch La  rice roll and vegan ham I liked to dip it with fish sauce taste more flavorful Happy to go on vegan meal once a while easy on my stomach and good for my health
name: Veggiebowl

author: Suzan L.
description: Can I just tell you how much Im in love with this place Best vegetarian Vietnamese Ive ever had in Van it beats Chau by leaps and bounds pricewise and flavorwise Veggiebowl is just an undiscovered gem by most and I guarantee if you find it you wont be able to stay away My favourite dish has to be their take on Bun Bo Hue Usually its made with beef and pig feet but Veggiebowls is loaded with juicy oyster mushrooms and fried tofu The broth is the perfect amount of spicy accompanied by a strong lemongrass aroma Just perfection I know Im literally waxing on and on about it like some kind of bad poet but it really is the shit Dont miss it Go there
name: Veggiebowl

author: Jeremy W.
description: We didnt miss the meat For a couple of omnivores Veggiebowls offerings certainly satisfies our stomachs with uniquely delicious flavours and textures This is our second visit and wanted to try a dish off their specials menu posted nondescriptly under the register We chose the steamed rice wraps usually filled with minced pork and were surprised by the taste of the veggie substitute they used Topped with fried garlic and paired with a flavourful nuoc cham it tasted great Also ordered was the Satay Noodles Packed with flavour and a spicy kick the tofu substituted in for the uaual chicken was a winner Nice bite to the noodles as well Of course no Vietnamese meal is complete without spring rolls and these did not dispppoint at all Crispy not oily and filled with veggie delights If ever wanting a break from the meat give this place a try your meatless meal will be accompanied by wonderful service as well The staff is very nice and knowledgeable
name: Veggiebowl

author: de o.
description: Hands down best vegan Vietnamese restaurant Super authentic very flavourful and affordable The pho is so tasty It is a must try
name: Veggiebowl

author: Jax M.
description: Ive tried so many different Pho noodles in North America both regular beef and vegetarian Over all their vegetarian noodle soup is the best The soup is with full of flavour not too salty or too msg taste Veggies are nicely cut perfectly boiled They are not too busy/noisy so you can relax and enjoy a bowl of soup Their customer service is always excellent very polite servers are always smiling and nice Which is kind of rare in Vietnamese restaurants I guess its culture thing Inside of restaurant is well organized very clean even their washroom is well taken care of Oh and their tea is my favourite I dont know what kind of tea it is but very good
name: Veggiebowl

author: Stan L.
description: Amazing vegetarian Vietnamese food without the pretentiousness of that OTHER veggie Vietnamese place Im almost afraid of giving this place 5 stars because consistently high ratings will eventually make this place too popular And over-popularity can be detrimental But the food here was amazing The Papaya Salad was crisp and vibrantly flavoured It was classified as an appetizer but for some people it could have served as a meal The Vermicelli Special was done as well as any traditional Vietnamese restaurant But the kicker was the tofu meat actually tasted as good as the real thing It tasted just like real BBQ pork sausage I dont know how they do it but it must be sorcery The deep-fried spring rolls were also so good that I didnt feel like I was being penalized for eating vegetarian Again portion size was generous The tofu salad rolls were okay Ill have to admit that I much prefer prawns or pork in my salad rolls But for what it was it was a nice change of pace Overall a terrific place to indulge in Vietnamese vegetarian food without having to fight for a seat with annoying hipsters at that OTHER crowded overrated Veggie place
name: Veggiebowl

author: Chere Michelle C.
description: Oh My God Be still my heart this place is bloody delicious Service is a bit hit and miss to be honest...but the fresh flavors and generous portion make up for it The fresh tofu rolls with peanut sauce are a must try I ordered the satay for lunch and it was a medium heat which was perfect It was so tasty and fresh with tons of tofu My mom ordered the lemongrass tofu and while tasty it was on the very dry side Portions are generous Prices reasonable Atmosphere is quiet despite being on Kingsway Its a gem Im going back tomorrow
name: Veggiebowl

author: Bonnie C.
description: I came here on a Monday evening with my two friends and we ended up ordering the Vermicelli Special B1 the Spicy Vegetarian Soup B4 the Vegetarian Curry with Vermicelli B6 and some sort of rice roll thing that is new and isnt on the menu didnt catch the name that the server had shown us a picture of on her phone All of the dishes were delicious and for those with a smaller appetite the portion sizes are enough for two meals My friends and I had to work hard to finish all of our food and by the end of it we were in a food coma Logistical details tea or water is provided free of charge We got to choose where we wanted to sit Chopsticks spoons and napkins were on the side for us to grab Inner decor was very nice and put together Clean Relaxed Didnt feel rushed at any point or anything Dont be fooled by the lack of reviews This place is amazing and you should definitely make your way over here when you get the chance Theres currently construction right next door so parking is a bit annoying but the food makes up for it
name: Veggiebowl

author: Kevin O.
description: I came here after shopping and did not have a pleasant experience This visit occurred near the end of November 2018 We went inside and had to wait a minute or two to get greeted and sat down The owner was running all over the place because it was becoming packed He was unable to speak English fluently which made it problematic when communicating to the table next to ours They were asking which of their menu items were popular We had our menus maybe 5 minutes into being seated After ordering it took over 40-45 minutes for the food to come out Of course it was noticeably understaffed likely one cook in the kitchen and the one person getting the orders and payments During this time this woman ordering take out had walked in and out of the store at least 4 to 5 times waiting for her order so I could tell service was pretty backed up Its a small store so thats understandable The owner had to call back up to come in and in came 3 young children 2 teens 1 child in elementary sometime later The food itself was not that great I had ordered the Hu Tieu Nam Vang I am not vegan or vegetarian but I can appreciate different foods The flavour wasnt bad but the ingredients were cheap as well You dont really get full from eating a large bowls worth of noodles I will say that it is nice and light and does not leave you feeling bloated but it honestly just felt like something can be easily made with the cheapest ingredients For instance there was tofu but the amount was hardly anything ie 2 thin slices of fried tofu grated carrots While it says it is a veggie bowl the ratio of soup to vegetables and noodles was unbalanced The price for what I ordered was rather depressing I believe it was around 13+ and I left very hungry which is in part due to the absurd wait time Again its understandable given the amount of people and perhaps the circumstances but for this specific experience its a no-no Would I recommend this place I would actually if you like light meals and are a vegetarian I personally would not go back again because the price is just not worth what I received in my honest opinion The taste of other dishes might be better so dont let me stop you from going TLDR Long wait Taste was okay but not filling Price not worth it Go if you want to try Vietnamese-styled vegetarian cuisine
name: Veggiebowl

author: Stephanie T.
description: Im not a vegetarian by any means but I left super stuffed and satisfied I have never had vegetarian pho and Im a phonatic Super good and filled with flavours I believe they boil ginger and fruits to give that flavourful taste I am def going to try to make this at home The spring rolls was pretty impressive and still gave that feel that you would have been eating the original spring roll with the meat Lotus salad was nice and refreshing Betel leaf was wicked and filling You gotta try it here
name: Veggiebowl

author: Gloria C.
description: Vegetarian Vietnamese food vs non vegetarian foodie Certified I never knew vegetarian pho could be so flavourful I get B3 vegetarian pho The soup is amazing you can really taste the 5 spice powder in the soup the soup is light and not heavy at all Every time I eat this I always get full half way compared to when Im eating normal pho I am never able to finish my noodles how is this possible Me and my fiancé are so blown away by the vegan ham it tastes like the real thing I absolutely LOVE the smokiness it has
name: Veggiebowl

author: Annie P.
description: I was suffering from a devastating hangover made so much worse by the fact that I am an insufferable baby when it comes to discomfort Since giving up meat Ive mourned the loss of of one of my favourite treats--pho My darling and long suffering partner was sick of hearing me lament my self-induced agony and in an attempt to shut me up lurked Yelp in search of vegetarian pho THEN like an angel sent down from heaven Veggiebowl appeared This vegetarian pho is SO DAMN GOOD My god is it ever good It cured me not only of my hangover but of many lost opportunities to indulge in soupy goodness I cant wait to go back and explore more of the menu I would encourage meat-eaters to not overlook Veggiebowl simply because its vegetarian This is veggies done right and you will not leave disappointed
name: Veggiebowl

author: Cytrus M.
description: Great restaurant Loved the food even though Im not an avid vegetarian Very filling as well Its a small place so large groups more than 8 may be hard to fit but its good for everyone otherwise The location is good as well and very easy to get to even by transit The prices are average around 10 per person and like I mentioned very filling
name: Veggiebowl

author: Emily C.
description: This is hands down the best vegetarian Vietnamese food in the hood Sure Chau Veggie Express nearby is pretty decent too  but if you want some really bold flavours extremely and consistently fresh ingredients Veggiebowl takes the cake The soup flavours are so rich e.g Pineapple to add sweet and sourness to their sweet and sour soup  thats genius more variety in veggies okra taro lotus stem celery snap peas cauliflower etc Ive had almost everything on their menu and nothing disappoints me not to mention its just way more relaxed in here despite being tucked right beside a huge construction site at the moment If you wanna talk ca$h moneh its also way cheaper than Chau Veggie Express great portioning youre getting noticeably fresh ingredients as well as avoiding the noisy and poor layout of Chau Veggie especially when they get busy If youre a fan of family-owned biz support these guys Also fresh-pressed orange and grapefruit juice made to order hell yeah 10/10 love this place
name: Veggiebowl

author: Super S.
description: Came here with my significant other we shared a spicy soup and made it extra spicy that was pretty good The lettuce rolls were a good appetizer We got a plate of the Vermicelli Special we feel that there could have been more flavors added in it was a tad bit bland
name: Veggiebowl

author: Bryan W.
description: This place is amazing Food is amazingly fresh and their dishes are unique We were simply looking for a vegetarian place to eat and veggie bowl came up so we decided to call to see if we can get a table for 6 when I called they said no seats but I said if Im coming now how long is the wait  they said got 6 Your coming now I said yes  then was told if Im not there in 15 mins the table would be given away I am so glad I called in advance  they had our table set up and ready for us when arrived They were pact after we sat down the line up just grew We saw why they are so popular the food was amazing fresh unique and tasty Servers were friendly our food didnt come out the fastest but still in a timely fashion for all of us I am definitely looking forward to trying their other dishes they have to offer Their rice bowl was really good  worth trying
name: Veggiebowl

author: Ruth H.
description: We love Kokomo They have the best GF vegan food in Vancouver They are some friendly Just why arent they opened before 11
name: Kokomo

author: Amanda X.
description: Kokomos açai bowls are delicious never seemed to have an issue until recently I found not one not two but several pieces of inedible plastic shards that could be mistaken as coconut shards Nice DEFINITELY NOT COCONUT SHARDS How the hell did those get in my açai bowl I couldve had a life and death choking experience Irresponsible
name: Kokomo

author: Chloe C.
description: This place is great if youre in a rush and are looking for something healthy I had their beet macro before which was really good and the two new items I tried this time around were really good as well Hemp Caesar Salad 5/5 This joins Beetbox and Heirloom as my favourite caesar salads of all time The dressing is super tasty and the nooch adds a nice umami to it The greens are fresh and the marinated chickpeas are flavourful The sunflower crackers are good as well but not crunchy I added soy curls to the salad and they were really delicious as well Coastal Macro Bowl 4/5 This was pretty good The dressing was flavourful but I found it a little too salty and there was too little of it The tempeh was tasty and the edamame hummus refreshing The greens were fresh and the squash soft and sweet This also came with cucumbers and pickled cabbage Mac and Cheese 3/5 This was just okay It was a little boring and bland in terms of flavour though the sunflower cracker bits on top saved it a little There was only two tiny piece of broccoli in there and overall I wasnt that impressed with this feature It is a little on the pricey side considering the portions you get but Id say its worth it since the bowls are really colourful and nice to look at and you feel good after eating them
name: Kokomo

author: Joy K.
description: I love Kokomos bowls and get them often But today I tried a smoothie of theirs and was very disappointed The smoothie came in a tiny cup compared all the competitors on west 4th which are 50% bigger then this and the roughly the same price It was more a juice then smoothie and very watery It was also served to me missing about an inch of smoothie from the top of the cup It was bad value for money Although the juice/smoothie was tasty itself I will just stick to the bowls from now on
name: Kokomo

author: Annie C.
description: I was in the Kits neighbourhood grabbing a coffee with a friend at Their There Cafe and she recommended this place for lunch Im not on a vegan diet or anything like that but am always intrigued by new spots Both the interior and exterior are super cute and aesthetically pleasing I tried the vegan laksa 11 as per my friends recommendation In my opinion vegan/superfoods have the reputation for being expensive but I found the price to be very reasonable considering the location and the portion I quite enjoyed my laksa the coconut flavour was prominent and the pickled carrots added a nice contrast I have not had many vegan food experiences but this was definitely a positive one
name: Kokomo

author: Ella D.
description: Picked up some takeout and ate down at the beach It was so good Very good first intro to tempeh Also got a coffee crisp shake The only negative was that the consistency of the shake was like water and it wasnt 100% but other than that all good
name: Kokomo

author: Dolan R.
description: The banana bread is promoted as to die for  TDF and it is actually a joke Some of the worst banana bread i have ever had They are trying to rip off the name of an actually amazing banana bread Their bowls are mediocre as well If you want underwhelming and meh This is the place
name: Kokomo

author: Fi Y.
description: I have been to Kokomo at kits for many occasions now and I love it every time From the cute decor to the staff and of course the food  everything is just superb Yes it is a little on the pricey side but I believe its totally worth it I dont mind spending my money on 100% wholesome goodness P.s Huge thanks to the staff  my klutzy hubby dropped his drink on our way back to the car He went back to re-order but the staff was kind enough to offer him a replacement for FREE  I will be soon Kokomo
name: Kokomo

author: Miriam T.
description: Unbelievably good healthy and quick vegan food Have not tried one thing from Kokomo Ive disliked  they have a serious knack for flavour I also love that theyre on Doordash their partnership extends delivery all the way to North Van BTW and that they have a fun rotating menu Was sad to see my favourite summer salad rolled out and replaced by a quinoa one for the colder months but hey life is full of disappointments I take comfort in the fact that their magical Hemp Caesar seems like a fixed item Another note of support their lovely staff who have given me everything from tea advice for constipation to free candy on Halloween Good vibes Kokomo remains a staple in my week-to-week diet
name: Kokomo

author: Shila B.
description: Atmosphere As you would expect given the concept that this is very clean and inviting You feel fresh Price Standard for most concept places and market value Customer service Very friendly with respectable time frame service Food Its different variations of salads that comply with most dietary needs including a cleanse that I was on for a few days therefore came with a friend of mine during our date nights I had the flower power salad with the dressing on the side
name: Kokomo

author: Amelia H.
description: Loved loved the Caesar salad 5/5 Really disliked the breakfast bowl neither of us could eat it beyond a few bites and we tossed it out 1/5 I also did not like the vibes of sitting in the restaurant with all of the messy open shelves and the stain covered cushions on benches
name: Kokomo

author: Buddy Z.
description: Very refreshing and flavourful food First time here was a pleasant surprise since I dont frequent the area Had the golden laska noodles and me time tea Certainly will be thinking of this place again when Im in the area thank you Kokomo staff The ginger pickled carrots where really nice It was almost uncomfortably warm inside is my only down point Hopefully that will be fixed in the future Weather was a full sunshine day and 5 degrees
name: Kokomo

author: Amy T.
description: Ive been wanting to try this place based on their Instagram posts and finally had the opportunity to It didnt disappoint Its smaller but more adorable than I expected I split the Beet Poke and Kokomo açaí The staff are super sweet and split the meal for us The tastes are amazing and leave you with zero guilt
name: Kokomo

author: Marie I.
description: GO JUST GO THERE AND ENJOY Such a nice find All the food is vegan gluten free tasty and the ingredients have integrity The staff is very friendly and helpful And the food came up right away I wanted something warm so I had the Golden Lakshmi Absolutely delicious and easy on my stomach Xoxo
name: Kokomo

author: Jennifer C.
description: Ive been to both locations and will be back regularly Still need to try the Coco Whip which is apparently only at the Kits location as of my visit Highly recommend the snack plate with hummus I forget the real name Nood Beach and Curry Laksa We tried the Hemp Kale Caesar as well which was really good flavor-wise but you must love chickpeas Or mix in sparingly
name: Kokomo

author: Philly G.
description: So initially I went on the website to check out their menu when a friend mentioned it months ago As I scrolled down a womans butt appeared out of nowhere Pictures of food butt food again I dont get this In the era of MeToo why do advertisers feel that this is necessary to sell food Unless it was art idk So anyways jump ahead several months and same friend says we should go here for lunch I am vegetarian and she always makes an effort to patronize veggie places when we go out to eat I did not at all link the place with the website I had visited before this I had one of the Macro bowls It was amazing A burst of flavours that medley together in ways I havent experienced before They use tempeh and other foods not commonly seen in these parts I am not really a hummous fan anymore just from overabusing hummous in my early vegetarian days but their hummous is the only hummous I will eat these days Tangy and bsolutely delicious I have been back 3 times since that first visit introducing all my veggie friends to it Ive had both Macro bowls and havent tried anything else yet but I will make my way through the menu Oh and they are also very accommodating I am doing the low carb thing and they will happily sub out the rice for greens with no extra charges I very much appreciate this And they are always friendly Even when I discovered that this is the place with the butt I still go back Go figure so much for my principles But I did leave off 1 star for the butt
name: Kokomo

author: Ozz N.
description: Love this place Recently moved to the neighborhood from Venice beach  this place reminds me of a mini cafe gratitude The macro bowls are amazing
name: Kokomo

author: Lara B.
description: From beginning to end this place rocks We absolutely LOVED the laksa and yesterday I also had a yummy smoothie Katie the owner is adorable and made us feel right at home...we will be back
name: Kokomo

author: skylar b.
description: Came all the way to try the cocowhip that the other location no longer carried Got the espresso one and it was BOMB Only complaint is that for the price it was on the smaller side so was a little bummed it wasnt a bigger portion Pricy but worth it Next time wont share with the boyfriend Please open location in LA
name: Kokomo

author: Niuniu Z.
description: Friendly service  fun menu My laksa bowl was super flavourful and addictive...Quite fresh and light despite the coconut creaminess A bit too much air conditioning  fanning in this weather though
name: Kokomo

author: Chloe C.
description: Ive tried all four burger patties including the brunch burger here and I must say that they are all equally good If youre a meat eater then youd probably like the faux real the best its approved by my brother but they also have lots of tasty veggie patties that dont sacrifice on flavour or texture Their new brussel sprouts dish is really good although they needed to be cooked more since they tasted a tad raw in the middle The sauce lends the brussel sprouts a lot of flavour and complements the dish surprisingly well It is quite an oily dish though which some people may be concerned about The yam fries are always great especially with the chipotle aioli The shakes and salads are okay not really my favourite
name: Planetary Burger

author: Aida K.
description: Definitely one of the BEST locally made veggie  vegan burger patties in town Was my FIRST time ordering at this place  I use a 3rd delivery app Ordered their Junior BBQ Bacum  Shroom burgers plus 2 fries Super delicious patties  would recommend to event meat lovers Patties were flavourful juicy and thick Fries in the bag were surprisingly small in portion I requested a substitution of a bread bun with iceberg lettuce instead  they complied 1 extra Minimal packaging is appreciated It perfectly hit the spot without the feeling of heavy weight sitting in my stomach Would come here again
name: Planetary Burger

author: Jill N.
description: Hands down the best vegan burger Ive had I got the shrooms burger with cheese and yam fries My friend got the harvest burger made with favs beans and pea protein and regular fries It was all exceptional they even had home made ketchup Will definitely be back to try the cauli burger made with cauliflower and chickpeas
name: Planetary Burger

author: Simin W.
description: Discovered my new favourite plant-based burger in Vancouver I went for Dineout Vancouver in 2020 and absolutely LOVED it The Shrooms Burger tasted just as juicy and flavourful couldnt believe it is made with mushrooms So delicious Their fries were also the perfect crispness and I devoured it all Also if youre lactose intolerant like me you can enjoy their amazing DAIRY-FREE SHAKES without worrying Highly recommend the strawberry shake and the chocolate shake is delicious too Whether youve never tried plant-based food before or looking for more vegan friendly diners go check this place out
name: Planetary Burger

author: Nicole B.
description: First time ordering from this shop through Uber eats It was so,so the fries were good The poutine tasty The milkshake was also tasty but their actual vegan burger patties leave much to be desired First of all the faux burger patty had a bitter aftertaste and tastes like the chaff of vegetables after theyve been juiced The compostable parts I read they are loaded with protein so I endeavoured to finish it but couldnt as it had a very earthy strong flavour without spices Not my jam Id rather eat meat TERRIBLE!!!Ill stick to beyond meat burgers
name: Planetary Burger

author: Matt B.
description: So great to have an all-vegan burger joint in my neck of the woods 4 burgers to choose from 3 different fries options and 4 different salads to choose from all quite customizable depending on your tastes I ordered the shroom dip burger 9 which comes with a delicious mushroom gravy dip The burger patty is pretty tasty seeming almost more like a hearty homemade patty rather than your typical junk food burger which I really appreciate Its rather pricey for the portion but all in all it was very tasty and I was happy I also added on a side kale caesar 6 which was well-done and a side order of fries 3 which you can order baked  a great touch For a big eater like me the meal is on the pricey side  and they offer no combo orders Despite this minor complaint I was really happy with this place and I hope they do really well
name: Planetary Burger

author: Sofie P.
description: This is a pretty decent vegan Burger and Fries place I enjoyed the burger a lot though I wouldnt say it was really convincing as faux meat the same way that Beyond might be Tasted more like a bean-patty which it was Fries were good gravy was gooD Had to add the cheese at home which was weird since I know they have vegan cheese that they add to the burger but they wouldnt make a poutine Mylkshake was just okay nothing special Very expensive for the sizing Worst thing is the price Theres no combo option so the burger and fries were separate 9 Burger + 1 for vegan cheese 4 for the fries and 1 for the gravy
name: Planetary Burger

author: Elvi R.
description: This was my second time going to Planetary Burger.Their menu has changed since the first time that ive been there This time i ordered the Faux Real with cheese fries and a chocolate milkshake This is a great place is youre craving a burger and fries The burger was messy but i didnt mind it Fries were cooked to perfection The milkshake I would probably not order again it didnt really taste like chocolate in my opinion I will be going back to try the Shroom Dip
name: Planetary Burger

author: Chef D.
description: Pretty unimpressed over all though the burger was good same with he chocolate shake the customer service on the phone was pretty bad When we ordered the brunch burger we were told it wasnt part of the dine outside menu when it was then we asked to pick it up around 2 and were told we could only pick it up right now because they had other customers waiting I have worked at restaurants and that is not how a phone order should go As well both me and my girlfriend both had stomach issues an hour or two after eating here which is unfortunate
name: Planetary Burger

author: Issabelle F.
description: Plant based comfort food hello A friend and I came to Planetary a few months ago right when they opened and loved it Im a bit picky when it comes to veggie burgers but I loved the one I got from Planetary I got the beet burger and my friend go the cheezeburger and we went halfsies so that we could try both We also split an order of the poutine topped w onion gravy and almond cheese because duh I was very impressed with the meat-like texture and flavour of both burgers The patties werent mushy or soggy like other veggie burgers Ive tried and the cheese in the cheezeburger tasted like real cheese The fries in my poutine were perfectly crispy and I was pleasantly surprised with how much flavour the onion gravy had The set up is fast casual You order at the counter grab a seat and they bring your food to you The staff working the day i visited were super friendly and recommended the beet burger which was a great call on her part Theyre temporarily closed at the moment due to Covid but I cant wait to come back for another beet burger when they re-open
name: Planetary Burger

author: Emily S.
description: Plant based fast food served with a smile Everything made in house Honestly so shocked at the meaty texture of the Cheezeburger patty and the cheeze I think they should sell that sliced cheeze I would loooooove a pack of vegan sliced cheeze singles It has the same melt and pull as kraft singles without the horrors of dairy Im shook HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE CHEEZE BURGER Cant wait to try the mushroom burger and the mylk shakes Only reason its a 4 and not 5 star because of the French fries The ones I recieved the rosemary fries with vegan parm were flavourless and soft Couldnt find the parm on them and only the slightest rosemary aftertaste at the end of the meal
name: Planetary Burger

author: Natalie W.
description: Decided to try this out for takeout and was pleasantly surprised I had their cauli spice burger and the air baked yam fries I added a slice of cheeze to my burger Overall it was a tasty burger Very flavourful and the cheeze is one of the better vegan cheeses Ive had The yam fries came with chipotle mayo and it was tasty Definitely would have been better fresh but still good regardless My brother had their regular fries and they held up pretty well They were crisp and salty My brother liked his faux real burger He thought the burger was a bit small and wasnt anything too special But was still a decent burger He liked the harvest burger better because there was a bit of texture added with the quinoa Overall if Im craving a burger and wanted a meat alternative Id probably order from them again
name: Planetary Burger

author: Derek G.
description: Wow We are jonesing to go back My partner and I went 100% vegan in December 2019 after being pescatarians for years Lots of our at-home meals have been vegan for years but we still ate eggs and dairy until last December Its been really fun discovering places that are 100% vegan  where you dont have to even think about what you can and cant eat what can or cant be substituted etc Some places are more appealing than others We tried Planetary Burger for the first time last weekend and we were blown away The food is delicious the staff are really friendly and helpful and its in a cool space One of the other reviewers commented that the burgers are a bit on the small side This is true They are delicious and obviously made with high-quality ingredient but definitely a bit small Usually a burger and fries will fill us both up In this case we ended up ordering a bit more food We each had the beet burger amazing and the poutine with almond cheese crazy-delicious but we were still a bit hungry The poutine was large and we shared it but we ended up getting a third burger having it cut in half and ordering a small poutine We also had a coffee milkshake And THEN we were full The milkshake was out of this world Theyve managed to make a shake that behaves like a dairy shake right down to how it melts with the centre still firm and the part around it melting Really delicious flavour with great depth Were going back this weekend and from here on out itll be one of our regular haunts for sure If I could change one thing I would suggest that the burgers be bigger but otherwise everything else is 100% fantastic Flavour quality friendliness cleanliness and great atmosphere To be clear the burgers arent tiny  just a bit on the smaller-than-usual side Thanks guys Derek PS I love that they use Violife cheese This is one of the rare good vegan cheeses that doesnt have that funky taste and it melts really well Ive since gone out on bought some to have at home
name: Planetary Burger

author: Mark B.
description: This place makes it easy to forget youre eating plant-based burgers Ive tried all the burger options and you really cant go wrong although the spiced cauliflower option is divine And the fries and shakes can stand up against any burger shack anywhere Do NOT forget to order a salad either So much yummy going on here
name: Planetary Burger

author: Jess S.
description: Located mid Main St area this tiny burger place offers vegan fast food/dinner-like food The place is small You walk in to find 2 tables and a counter I ordered the burger tasting flight and choose Beet Beet lentil  quinoa patty with cumin smoked paprika  nutritional yeast Spicy cauliflower Spicy cauliflower chickpea with cayenne parsley  nutritional yeast and Mushroom Mushroom  roasted garlic patty with oregano  caramelized onions and a side of poutine Topped with roasted onion gravy  squeaky almond cheese I liked the Beet burger the best It was crunchy and you could taste all the different components The Spicy Cauliflower was fine but I would have never guessed it was cauliflower I didnt care for the Mushroom It was a bit soggy and not particularly flavourful The poutine is also ok The gravy was a bit too salty and the crinkle fries was a weird touch for me Service was good I was there only customer but they were very friendly They also serve your meal on an old school silver lunch tray which was cute
name: Planetary Burger

author: Sarah M.
description: Okay yes the burgers are good  but the milkshakes UNREAL They taste like what I remember McDonalds to be and not in a weird way Im obsessed Like I actually want to buy their milkshake machine and take it home with me along with the ingredients and make my own milkshake nightly Highly recommend Sooooo good
name: Planetary Burger

author: Gary O.
description: Walked by and decided to try this place out It is a plant based restaurant with four different kinds of plant based burgers that all looks like they are made in house They also have items such as fries vegan gravy and salads To drink the have soda and shakes I tried the cauliflower curry burger and it was really good Will come back again to try out the food items since it all looks so good Staff were all nice and friendly as well
name: Planetary Burger

author: Scott L.
description: So Im not sure what you want when you eat a burger but when I do Id like a little flavour..we had the mushroom patty and the beyond style burger and they were bland not even a little salt the fries were okay tuff to judge when you get take out cause they are usually soggy by the time your home and theirs were i wouldnt eat here again Id rather eat a beyond burger at home
name: Planetary Burger

author: Gary M.
description: A great plant based burger joint Tried the Mushroom burger  Rosemary fries with their special sauce Surprised me it was very very good Another tried the spicy cauliflower burger  poutine The spicy cauliflower burger is very mild and Im sure even the timid will like it The staff was friendly and efficient They even answered questions about ingredients Theres even a gluten free bun for the burgers
name: Planetary Burger

author: Mike S.
description: Im not a huge fan of veggie burgers and often feel like Im missing out when my wife recommends them Not so with Planetary Their food is delicious and the milkshakes are insane
name: Planetary Burger

author: Chloe C.
description: Ive tried all four burger patties including the brunch burger here and I must say that they are all equally good If youre a meat eater then youd probably like the faux real the best its approved by my brother but they also have lots of tasty veggie patties that dont sacrifice on flavour or texture Their new brussel sprouts dish is really good although they needed to be cooked more since they tasted a tad raw in the middle The sauce lends the brussel sprouts a lot of flavour and complements the dish surprisingly well It is quite an oily dish though which some people may be concerned about The yam fries are always great especially with the chipotle aioli The shakes and salads are okay not really my favourite
name: Planetary Burger

author: Aida K.
description: Definitely one of the BEST locally made veggie  vegan burger patties in town Was my FIRST time ordering at this place  I use a 3rd delivery app Ordered their Junior BBQ Bacum  Shroom burgers plus 2 fries Super delicious patties  would recommend to event meat lovers Patties were flavourful juicy and thick Fries in the bag were surprisingly small in portion I requested a substitution of a bread bun with iceberg lettuce instead  they complied 1 extra Minimal packaging is appreciated It perfectly hit the spot without the feeling of heavy weight sitting in my stomach Would come here again
name: Planetary Burger

author: Jill N.
description: Hands down the best vegan burger Ive had I got the shrooms burger with cheese and yam fries My friend got the harvest burger made with favs beans and pea protein and regular fries It was all exceptional they even had home made ketchup Will definitely be back to try the cauli burger made with cauliflower and chickpeas
name: Planetary Burger

author: Simin W.
description: Discovered my new favourite plant-based burger in Vancouver I went for Dineout Vancouver in 2020 and absolutely LOVED it The Shrooms Burger tasted just as juicy and flavourful couldnt believe it is made with mushrooms So delicious Their fries were also the perfect crispness and I devoured it all Also if youre lactose intolerant like me you can enjoy their amazing DAIRY-FREE SHAKES without worrying Highly recommend the strawberry shake and the chocolate shake is delicious too Whether youve never tried plant-based food before or looking for more vegan friendly diners go check this place out
name: Planetary Burger

author: Nicole B.
description: First time ordering from this shop through Uber eats It was so,so the fries were good The poutine tasty The milkshake was also tasty but their actual vegan burger patties leave much to be desired First of all the faux burger patty had a bitter aftertaste and tastes like the chaff of vegetables after theyve been juiced The compostable parts I read they are loaded with protein so I endeavoured to finish it but couldnt as it had a very earthy strong flavour without spices Not my jam Id rather eat meat TERRIBLE!!!Ill stick to beyond meat burgers
name: Planetary Burger

author: Matt B.
description: So great to have an all-vegan burger joint in my neck of the woods 4 burgers to choose from 3 different fries options and 4 different salads to choose from all quite customizable depending on your tastes I ordered the shroom dip burger 9 which comes with a delicious mushroom gravy dip The burger patty is pretty tasty seeming almost more like a hearty homemade patty rather than your typical junk food burger which I really appreciate Its rather pricey for the portion but all in all it was very tasty and I was happy I also added on a side kale caesar 6 which was well-done and a side order of fries 3 which you can order baked  a great touch For a big eater like me the meal is on the pricey side  and they offer no combo orders Despite this minor complaint I was really happy with this place and I hope they do really well
name: Planetary Burger

author: Sofie P.
description: This is a pretty decent vegan Burger and Fries place I enjoyed the burger a lot though I wouldnt say it was really convincing as faux meat the same way that Beyond might be Tasted more like a bean-patty which it was Fries were good gravy was gooD Had to add the cheese at home which was weird since I know they have vegan cheese that they add to the burger but they wouldnt make a poutine Mylkshake was just okay nothing special Very expensive for the sizing Worst thing is the price Theres no combo option so the burger and fries were separate 9 Burger + 1 for vegan cheese 4 for the fries and 1 for the gravy
name: Planetary Burger

author: Elvi R.
description: This was my second time going to Planetary Burger.Their menu has changed since the first time that ive been there This time i ordered the Faux Real with cheese fries and a chocolate milkshake This is a great place is youre craving a burger and fries The burger was messy but i didnt mind it Fries were cooked to perfection The milkshake I would probably not order again it didnt really taste like chocolate in my opinion I will be going back to try the Shroom Dip
name: Planetary Burger

author: Chef D.
description: Pretty unimpressed over all though the burger was good same with he chocolate shake the customer service on the phone was pretty bad When we ordered the brunch burger we were told it wasnt part of the dine outside menu when it was then we asked to pick it up around 2 and were told we could only pick it up right now because they had other customers waiting I have worked at restaurants and that is not how a phone order should go As well both me and my girlfriend both had stomach issues an hour or two after eating here which is unfortunate
name: Planetary Burger

author: Issabelle F.
description: Plant based comfort food hello A friend and I came to Planetary a few months ago right when they opened and loved it Im a bit picky when it comes to veggie burgers but I loved the one I got from Planetary I got the beet burger and my friend go the cheezeburger and we went halfsies so that we could try both We also split an order of the poutine topped w onion gravy and almond cheese because duh I was very impressed with the meat-like texture and flavour of both burgers The patties werent mushy or soggy like other veggie burgers Ive tried and the cheese in the cheezeburger tasted like real cheese The fries in my poutine were perfectly crispy and I was pleasantly surprised with how much flavour the onion gravy had The set up is fast casual You order at the counter grab a seat and they bring your food to you The staff working the day i visited were super friendly and recommended the beet burger which was a great call on her part Theyre temporarily closed at the moment due to Covid but I cant wait to come back for another beet burger when they re-open
name: Planetary Burger

author: Emily S.
description: Plant based fast food served with a smile Everything made in house Honestly so shocked at the meaty texture of the Cheezeburger patty and the cheeze I think they should sell that sliced cheeze I would loooooove a pack of vegan sliced cheeze singles It has the same melt and pull as kraft singles without the horrors of dairy Im shook HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE CHEEZE BURGER Cant wait to try the mushroom burger and the mylk shakes Only reason its a 4 and not 5 star because of the French fries The ones I recieved the rosemary fries with vegan parm were flavourless and soft Couldnt find the parm on them and only the slightest rosemary aftertaste at the end of the meal
name: Planetary Burger

author: Natalie W.
description: Decided to try this out for takeout and was pleasantly surprised I had their cauli spice burger and the air baked yam fries I added a slice of cheeze to my burger Overall it was a tasty burger Very flavourful and the cheeze is one of the better vegan cheeses Ive had The yam fries came with chipotle mayo and it was tasty Definitely would have been better fresh but still good regardless My brother had their regular fries and they held up pretty well They were crisp and salty My brother liked his faux real burger He thought the burger was a bit small and wasnt anything too special But was still a decent burger He liked the harvest burger better because there was a bit of texture added with the quinoa Overall if Im craving a burger and wanted a meat alternative Id probably order from them again
name: Planetary Burger

author: Derek G.
description: Wow We are jonesing to go back My partner and I went 100% vegan in December 2019 after being pescatarians for years Lots of our at-home meals have been vegan for years but we still ate eggs and dairy until last December Its been really fun discovering places that are 100% vegan  where you dont have to even think about what you can and cant eat what can or cant be substituted etc Some places are more appealing than others We tried Planetary Burger for the first time last weekend and we were blown away The food is delicious the staff are really friendly and helpful and its in a cool space One of the other reviewers commented that the burgers are a bit on the small side This is true They are delicious and obviously made with high-quality ingredient but definitely a bit small Usually a burger and fries will fill us both up In this case we ended up ordering a bit more food We each had the beet burger amazing and the poutine with almond cheese crazy-delicious but we were still a bit hungry The poutine was large and we shared it but we ended up getting a third burger having it cut in half and ordering a small poutine We also had a coffee milkshake And THEN we were full The milkshake was out of this world Theyve managed to make a shake that behaves like a dairy shake right down to how it melts with the centre still firm and the part around it melting Really delicious flavour with great depth Were going back this weekend and from here on out itll be one of our regular haunts for sure If I could change one thing I would suggest that the burgers be bigger but otherwise everything else is 100% fantastic Flavour quality friendliness cleanliness and great atmosphere To be clear the burgers arent tiny  just a bit on the smaller-than-usual side Thanks guys Derek PS I love that they use Violife cheese This is one of the rare good vegan cheeses that doesnt have that funky taste and it melts really well Ive since gone out on bought some to have at home
name: Planetary Burger

author: Mark B.
description: This place makes it easy to forget youre eating plant-based burgers Ive tried all the burger options and you really cant go wrong although the spiced cauliflower option is divine And the fries and shakes can stand up against any burger shack anywhere Do NOT forget to order a salad either So much yummy going on here
name: Planetary Burger

author: Jess S.
description: Located mid Main St area this tiny burger place offers vegan fast food/dinner-like food The place is small You walk in to find 2 tables and a counter I ordered the burger tasting flight and choose Beet Beet lentil  quinoa patty with cumin smoked paprika  nutritional yeast Spicy cauliflower Spicy cauliflower chickpea with cayenne parsley  nutritional yeast and Mushroom Mushroom  roasted garlic patty with oregano  caramelized onions and a side of poutine Topped with roasted onion gravy  squeaky almond cheese I liked the Beet burger the best It was crunchy and you could taste all the different components The Spicy Cauliflower was fine but I would have never guessed it was cauliflower I didnt care for the Mushroom It was a bit soggy and not particularly flavourful The poutine is also ok The gravy was a bit too salty and the crinkle fries was a weird touch for me Service was good I was there only customer but they were very friendly They also serve your meal on an old school silver lunch tray which was cute
name: Planetary Burger

author: Sarah M.
description: Okay yes the burgers are good  but the milkshakes UNREAL They taste like what I remember McDonalds to be and not in a weird way Im obsessed Like I actually want to buy their milkshake machine and take it home with me along with the ingredients and make my own milkshake nightly Highly recommend Sooooo good
name: Planetary Burger

author: Gary O.
description: Walked by and decided to try this place out It is a plant based restaurant with four different kinds of plant based burgers that all looks like they are made in house They also have items such as fries vegan gravy and salads To drink the have soda and shakes I tried the cauliflower curry burger and it was really good Will come back again to try out the food items since it all looks so good Staff were all nice and friendly as well
name: Planetary Burger

author: Scott L.
description: So Im not sure what you want when you eat a burger but when I do Id like a little flavour..we had the mushroom patty and the beyond style burger and they were bland not even a little salt the fries were okay tuff to judge when you get take out cause they are usually soggy by the time your home and theirs were i wouldnt eat here again Id rather eat a beyond burger at home
name: Planetary Burger

author: Gary M.
description: A great plant based burger joint Tried the Mushroom burger  Rosemary fries with their special sauce Surprised me it was very very good Another tried the spicy cauliflower burger  poutine The spicy cauliflower burger is very mild and Im sure even the timid will like it The staff was friendly and efficient They even answered questions about ingredients Theres even a gluten free bun for the burgers
name: Planetary Burger

author: Mike S.
description: Im not a huge fan of veggie burgers and often feel like Im missing out when my wife recommends them Not so with Planetary Their food is delicious and the milkshakes are insane
name: Planetary Burger

author: Annika G.
description: 4.5/5 so good while we visited vancouver this was our favorite spot woweeee the spring rolls were so good even my BF who isnt really a fan of vegetarian food usually was caught off guard by how delicious everything was the service was smooth and friendly the ambience of the restaurant was really nice  the decorations and the overall restaurant was beautiful we got there at a good time around 11:30AM not long after it opened and luckily we did so as it got so busy as were finishing up so make sure to come early while there we tried the charcoal lemonade spring rolls papaya salad and lettuce wraps we only tried from the appetizers as we werent too interested in the entrees but man were we satisfied and full from the 3 appetizers each was was delicious and did not feel heavy i felt super healthy after eating all of it the charcoal lemonade was very interesting it did not stain our teeth and tasted like an earthy lemonade that was not too sour moreover it tasted even fresher with mint leaves that i borrowed from our appetizers i usually dont like eating out but this spot i would love to return to
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Emma W.
description: Wow I am so happy my friend recommended this new spot during my recent visit home to Vancouver Do Chay Yaletown is a beautiful and hip spot equipped with hanging plants serving up healthy and clean Vietnamese dishes and cocktails We stopped by at 11:30am on a Friday and were the first people there we made a reservation just in case They have great seating options inside and out My friend and I shared the mango salad black truffle tofu and eggplant dish Everything was delicious but the tofu was definitely our fave It was perfectly crisp and the sauce it came with was perfectly light and flavored without being overwhelming We also got black lemonades which was a wonderful accompaniment to the meal I will definitely be back
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Elvi R.
description: Decided to go to Do Chay in Yaletown for Mothers Day dinner Everything we ordered was delicious We started with the spring rolls and the wings I can probably have 10 orders of the wings Theyre so good super crispy and I love the sweet and spicy sauce that theyre coated in Before becoming vegan lemongrass beef was a go to for me so I was super excited to try their lemongrass tofu Loved the crispy shallots on top Was very flavourful I would order it again It was a very generous portion We also ordered the Bún Bò Huế but got it with rice noodles instead of the spaghetti looking noodles It was very flavourful and very spicy in my opinion The waitress said it wasnt but it definitely warmed me up The kind is spicy you want to keep eating I went back last weekend and was so happy again Definitely recommend this place if you like Vietnamese food Bon Appétit
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Siimmy G.
description: Amazing Vegan/Vegetarian cuisine in YT We tried four different vegan dishes and the flavour was amazing The vegan chicken wings made from mushrooms were definitely my fav and apparently the most popular The menu does change quite a bit I was told so Ill def be back
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Jacqueline W.
description: So amazing I cant back the very next day Theres a reason why this place won best new restaurant 2020 You wing miss meat eating here Everything is so flavourful The spring rolls are crispy yet not oily The fish sauce it comes with makes the dish come together so well Also tried the black garlic braised eggplant Absolutely delicious I love eggplant now 10/10 on all dishes
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Be F.
description: We stumbled on this place while trying to find Meet and ended up having a way better meal We had the Prosperity Dumplings  complex tender and flavourful in a lovely broth the pho  very authentic with the surprising win of avocado slices and tofu skin and Uncle Hings Wings breaded oyster mushrooms with a sweet sauce Fabu Wed order all three again but want to come back and try everything else first starting with the lemongrass tofu and the vegan Vern
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Cy W.
description: Delicious food that is kind to the environment We have been a fan of the restaurants Kingsway location so we are excited that it opened a second location right in the heart of Yaletown which is in need of a place offering delicious and inventive vegetarian food We were looking for a light meal and decided to go Do Chay for some healthy dinner For appetizer we were curious about the Uncle Hings Wings which are deep fried breaded mushrooms in a sticky sweet and sour sauce It definitely taste very similar to chicken wings We also got the Spring Rolls which comes with mustard green cut into perfect wrapping shape and herb basil/sage For entrees we shared the Black Garlic Eggplant served with yo choy and rice We cant wait to go back and try out all the other creative vegetarian dishes they have on the menu
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Charly S.
description: Spring rolls served with greens for wrapping and Black Garlic Eggplant/Tofu  these are two of my all-time favourite foods The spring rolls are crispy outside and chewy inside  wrap in the accompanying greens and dip  soooo delicious just like Vietnam The Black Garlic Eggplant and tofu is a savoury sweet smokey dish served with perfectly cooked fluffy rice and a few greens is Vietnamese comfort food perfect for cold wet Vancouver nights The mango salad is delicious but I prefer these types of salads a little crunchier/less soft The Pho is the best vegan pho Ive had  rich yet smooth and clean filling and colourful This Yaletown location is bright and cheery nice patio out front If youre looking for plant based Vietnamese look no further Enjoy
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Chloe C.
description: This is my dads new favourite vegan spot The food was so delicious but the portions were definitely small for the price The decor is really amazing though Uncle Hings Wings 5/5 This was the best deep fried mushroom dish Ive ever had We all couldnt stop raving about it The batter is crispy and not greasy and the mushrooms had a great texture The flavour was the perfect balance of sweet and spicy Black Garlic Eggplant 5/5 This was so flavourful The eggplant and tofu was cooked perfectly and the sauce was amazing The textures and flavours were on point Satay Noodles 5/5 The broth was really good and I loved the crispiness of the seitan The noodles were nice and chewy and there was a lot of vegetables I wish there was slightly more seitan but we all loved this dish nonetheless Curry Bowl 4/5 This was good but it was served lukewarm I wish there was more curry but the pumpkin croquette things were really interesting as they were chewy and had a nice mild flavour The potatoes were very undercooked though and the eggplant also could have been more tender The curry was quite chunky and it could have been more liquid in my opinion but overall it was still very enjoyable I definitely recommend this place It has the best vegan Vietnamese food in Vancouver and a great place to go for date night or if you are looking to splurge a little
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Dave S.
description: Wait wasnt bad When I arrived with my wife they had seating for 2 inside and all the tables outside were open It wasnt that cold so we sat outside and the bartender was kind enough to start the heater for us We waited about 10 minutes to get our order in  just two bowls In the mean time after we had ordered another table of 3 came and sat down We were told 15 minutes later they are a little backed up so itll be a few more minutes 10 minutes later my wifes bowl arrived My wife finished her bowl and during this the table that arrived after us got 5 different plates of theirs before I got my one bowl I told the waitress this is odd but all I was told was they were backed up Food wasnt worth the hype but just okay
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Emy P.
description: We were so excited to try this new spot in Van Everything was alright until we discovered a dark hair inside one of the tofu piece Daikon Cakes we had ordered 2 nights ago This is unacceptable especially with the current situation the world lives in Everything else was delicious and its too bad they cant control their food better
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Angela W.
description: I have been wanting to try this for a while but Kingsway location is out of the way for me Im so glad they open in Yaletown Interior is very chic and clean gives a nice comfy vibe Food was great both taste and visual-wise and satisfying even though theres no meat we had 5 appetizers and 1 main shared among 3 of us small to medium tummies and it was just right I loved all of them except maybe the Black Truffle Tofu which doesnt have much of a truffle taste but has strong ginger taste which I hate but my parents liked it The Black Garlic Eggplant was excellent though the rice was a little too mushy for my taste the eggplant was egg-cellent though Pricing reasonable and service good Will definitely revisit soon to try rest of the menu
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Matt B.
description: Very happy to see this place open a second location replacing House Special Everything about the original location is copied well here with the addition of a very pleasant patio out front overlooking this quiet part of Hamilton Menu is a bit smaller than the Kingsway location but they have all the staples here I ordered takeout for lunch here with a friend we ordered the black garlic eggplant and the vegan pho both exceptional and both 15 Very generous portions too for reasonable prices especially for Yaletown The order was ready in 20 minutes and everything was perfect Great to see this gem of a place expand
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Amir A.
description: We did a review on this restaurant on our show We loved it The food is great https://youtu.be/likL-SZPNzw
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Roger D.
description: Even if you are not a vegan this place is delicious Food is fresh and simply fantastic I have been here several times and Im always impressed Remember that Thursday night is busy in Yaletown
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: C B.
description: Good space cool decor but Cmon Seriously Gluten free vegan vegetarian Trendy empty vague premises that suck a tiny % of the community in for an empty food experience at a grossly inflated price Went there tonight with a friend so sad A dish titled Uncle Hings wings 5 mushrooms pieces deep fried tossed with the usual sad suspects so boring If your ridiculous sales and marketing pitch is vague vegan and boring why not have a protein name based dish  Lets have Turkey Tofu or a plant hot dog as well Looking at the menu basic 9 ingredients done 19 ways All our dishes lacked taste texture the Vegan pho was miserable maybe rename  Pathetic Pho   Or just say left over veggies thrown in a bowl Would never go back
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Angelina C.
description: First time at this place and I was not disappointed We go the uncle hings wings satay noodles and black garlic eggplant The wings were definitely my favorite The soup has a good potential but it came out warm so I wasnt able to enjoy it to the fullest Overall the restaurant itself is very welcoming and the all of the staff is very polite Well definitely be back
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Amy C.
description: I loved their first location and am so happy they opened a second The Yaletown location is spacious with great outdoor seating You got to get the salad rolls  THEY ARE AMAZING The Vegan verm is absolutely delicious I like the pho but found the entire avocado a bit too much I asked to sub the avocado for more bean curd instead
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Tommy D.
description: Food is good but the service is incredibly slow Make sure youre not hungry when you go there because you will be extremely hangry Have dined in and ordered for pick up and both times waited over 30 minutes for the order
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Pankti P.
description: Food is amazing and service is fast too Highly recommended for vegetarian lovers Please reserve your spot before going otherwise wait bit longer during peak time Overall great food and good experience
name: Do Chay Saigon Vegetarian

author: Tracey N.
description: Great food and friendly staff I love their homemade nut milks Lots of seating and nice atmosphere
name: Kind Cafe

author: Babak H.
description: Excellent food and staff Spacious and welcoming atmosphere Highly recommend Kind Cafe
name: Kind Cafe

author: Angus M.
description: I didnt realize that this was a no waste restaurant While the food was actually really good something about leaving a 4.00 deposit for a glass take out container leaves a bad taste The funny thing is I had my shake in a glass mason jar and only paid 1.00 for that I wonder why not give that as an option I wish they said something before I ordered But other than that it wasnt too bad They have a good selection of vegan and non dairy items and their shakes were quite good without leaving me stupidly full
name: Kind Cafe

author: Le Roi E.
description: Anti vaccine establishment Youd think a vegan place thats supposedly about being healthy would support public health guidelines Will never be a customer here
name: Kind Cafe

author: EastVan F.
description: Anti-mask/vaxx establishment not to mention suuuuper overpriced for what they offer Id recommend staying away unless you feel like catching the rona
name: Kind Cafe

author: Issabelle F.
description: Kind is the cafe of my dreams Im in love with their two-level airy aesthetically pleasing space Pre-covid Ive dined in numerous times and during Covid Ive ordered take out once Through all my experiences the staff have been so friendly Kind Cafe hires kind people The staff were especially appreciative when I came in to pick up my take out order Their menu is 100% plant-based which is awesome Ive brought my meat-loving friends here and even they love their menu I think Ive tried almost their whole menu at this point but my favourites are their carrot lox bagel tastes like real lox smashed avo bagel nutty spice smoothie bowl balanced greens smoothie bowl power up bowl and the buffalo tofu sandwich What I love about their food is that it fills you up without making you feel gross and bloated Since its located in the bustling South Main St area parking can be a bit of a pain on the major streets However Ive been lucky sometimes finding parking in the back roads and then walking over But your best bet would be to take transit down I cant wait to enjoy another carrot lox bagel people-watching on their mezzanine with a delicious beetroot latte in hand SupportLocal
name: Kind Cafe

author: Chloe C.
description: Best flatbreads and some of the best sandwiches in Vancouver However their baked goods seem to be getting worse for some reason I use to love their scones but this time they were incredible dry The chocolate zucchini muffin was also not good the sugar granules on top were unnecessary and the banana in the muffin was not advertised Their new caprese sandwich is really good though Their pesto is amazing as well as their foccacia bread and cheeze I added tempeh and it was 10/10 Their breakfast sandwich with tempeh tofu mayo and cheeze might be my favourite though Sadly I was not a fan of their yam fries or their mac and cheese I did really enjoy their falafel wrap though The tortilla they use is fantastic and their falafel is not dry which is quite rare to find at least in my experience
name: Kind Cafe

author: Elena A.
description: If youre craving for Vegan food look no further Kind cafe offers a huge variety of vegan food coffees and desserts I love their Carrot Lox Bagel its my favorite Their bowls are great as well My favorite is Mediterranean Bowl with Falafel so good I never leave Kind Cafe without getting Blue Lavender latte It has blue-green algae maca cinnamon mct oil lavender SO DELICIOUS Golden Sunshine that contains turmeric lucuma house spice blend tahini is my second fave here I recommend this place to all my friends I really love the ambiance and food there
name: Kind Cafe

author: Max L.
description: Got two bowls for myself and my 4yo Kind one tasted okay Mediterranean had very sad dry falafels in it and tasted old neither of us could eat it We both had an upset stomach after and now we have to bring the 4 deposit containers back Not impressed
name: Kind Cafe

author: Michelle H.
description: SO GOOD AND ALL VEGAN Wowowow after having this i dont ever crave pizza from Dominos anymore sorry Dominos I got the Buffalo Cauliflower Flatbread and it was delicious so flavourful and just amazing  The serving size was also perfect and I enjoyed it so much that although I was stuffed I felt sad after it was all gone  I was also very impressed with the variety of their menu as they are an all vegan cafe/eatery They are also zero waste which I LOVE So PSA remember to bring your own containers if youre someone who always has leftovers as they do not provide take out containers This would be a great place to work or catch up with friends as there is an upstairs balcony with plenty of couches as well as work spaces I wished I had discovered this place earlier as Im no longer in Vancouver anymore so go check it out and lmk what you guys think
name: Kind Cafe

author: Bella C.
description: LOVE all that the cafe stands for Zero waste and vegan  Love that Im not vegan myself but I do love how environmentally cautious this cafe is Loved the ambiance and setting here Perfect place for me to enjoy a quick snack and get some studying done I ordered the avo toast and it was delicious You cant go wrong with avocado and tomatoes and bagels It is a little pricier as it avocado toast is easier to make however they use fresh ingredients The Blue Coconut Dream Smoothie Bowl was so fun to look at Interesting how there was zucchini in the smoothie You cant really taste the zucchini or blue algae as the banana and coconut overpowers the veggies The granola is housemade and I do love how nutritious the smoothie bowl was I would love to try the other smoothie bowls I would recommend this place as a good study place with great healthy options
name: Kind Cafe

author: Lauren L.
description: I like these types of places for good honest clean food I was surprised I had ended up parking right in front It was a sign So I changed our girl date to eat here instead Clean spacious and dining with other vegans or healthy inspired people always feels good It felt like a positive experience and helps to keep me motivated in life Ok Im not vegan but I do like clean food and from time to time I crave it Its about timing And today timing was perfect I had the beet latte unsweetened and perfect The food was very good too Happy that they can do dine in in todays COVID world
name: Kind Cafe

author: Julia H.
description: Super cute cafe in the Main Street area where can get some work done Plenty of seating at the bar and the community tables you cant have laptops at the actual table This restaurant is as environmentally friendly as it can be  Theres no one use items theres no napkins but reusable towel which is really neat I think they also dont have to go cutlery so you would have to bring your own if you want to take out Ive tried the Cesar kale salad which I really enjoyed very fancy and flavourful and I added to falafel once which isnt fried which was a surprise It was also pretty good Second time I came here I got the cauliflower flat bread Its not bad not my favourite there was too much sauce for my liking Portion sizes here are fair This is definitely a nice spot to check out in the neighbourhood
name: Kind Cafe

author: Isabella M.
description: FYI none of the staff or chefs wear masks and there are no protective barriers The food was good and I like that theyre promoting zero waste plans based cuisine Ill wait until after the pandemic to feel safe eating there
name: Kind Cafe

author: Shila B.
description: This is a brand new café thats open up on Main Street with a wide Variety of unique menu items and beverage options including my favourite lavender latte Theres lots of seating inside although it is limited for the pandemic I had a Matcha latte to go Just a heads up that they do not except cash right now because of the pandemic so I had to come back the following day so that I could pay with credit card This is only temporary because of the COVID 19 The customer service is more than awesome and they were helpful in answering my questions the first time
name: Kind Cafe

author: Pablo M.
description: 10/10 everything is fresh and homemade Perfect combination of great environment staff and food It just got to my top 5 coffee places in Vancity Love the music as well Super calm and relaxing Makes you feel comfortable and welcomed
