name: Kind Cafe

author: Maya O.
description: Staff is Kind so kudos for being on brand  As for the food  theyve got some good menu items but a few questionable ones as well Green goddess salad is good Bagels are a safe bet I liked the smokiness of the carrot lox The avocado bagel was good as well though not exceptionally exciting However still enjoyable I can appreciate food with some simplicity I would steer clear from the Tempeh Reuben Ordered it and and no one at the table wanted more than one bite Initially its edible but the combination of flavours just tastes off Hated that I had to be wasteful at a no waste cafe but I couldnt stomach it Id like to reiterate the good service when I mentioned the situation to the staff they replaced it with the avocado bagel which I enjoyed at no extra cost Theyve got kombucha on tap Always a plus Ive tried the green and blue smoothie and both were yummy Not a huge fan of the black sesame latte as it was a bit heavy and not the tastiest But maybe itd be good paired with a baked good Ive been here a few times and enjoyed my overall experience every time so I would definitely recommend trying them out I also realize taste is subjective so maybe youll vibe with the stuff I didnt Thank you Kind for what youre doing A good addition to Vancouvers Vegan scene I look forward to future growth and fine tuning you got this
name: Kind Cafe

author: Tom S.
description: Tasty salads knowledgeable staff regarding gluten allergies These are not the typical salads the variety of ingredients and flavors is remarkable We just happened upon the restaurant and wow what a treat The ambience was light and fun emphasizing kindness They even have a huge neon peace sign upstairs We had lattes that were flavored but not sweetened awesome with hazelnut I had the Kind Salad and my wife had the Super Salad Both were delicious and healthy
name: Kind Cafe

author: Makenzie D.
description: This place is everything you could ever want in a vegan cafe  modern great food great drinks kind staff I am very lucky to live in proximity to this place If youre looking for a great place to study the atmosphere inside this cafe is very relaxing  however there are quite a few tables where electronics are discouraged Very zen My favourite food here is the flat bread There are several different kinds such as BBQ Tempeh and Buffalo Cauliflower Great qualify with an amazing taste you hardly remember its vegan My favourite drink is the Blue Lavender Latte A vibrant blue drink with a soft and subtle floral flavour and it never leaves my stomach hurting because it is made with no dairy obvi Did I mention they made their own in house hazelnut milk This place is ZERO WASTE Which is something that needs to be highlighted This is revolutionary and completely doable for ALL cafes Take note from this cafe they are doing everything right
name: Kind Cafe

author: Vivian D.
description: it is hard to find a restaurant/cafe place in Vancouver that has delicious food great prices and beautiful/cozy ambiance inside...the kind cafe on Main St is that what a find i loved how eco friendly they are vegan low/zero waste clean and an all around delight to be a patron of highly recommend their commitment to healthy food helping the environment and being a friendly neighborhood joint is phenomenal
name: Kind Cafe

author: Ben R.
description: Always such good food service presentation and overall experience Couldnt recommend this restaurant enough
name: Sula

author: Jennie Y.
description: We had a lovely dinner here last week The chatpata sev puri crispy wheat papdi stuffed with chaat topped with spicy potato sev was amazing and packed with flavour The butter chicken and lamb curries were also great Their garlic naan was fried perfectly extra crispy on the outside but still fluffy on the inside We sat inside and felt like we were transported to a tropical island with the open air windows high ceilings and eclectic decor
name: Sula

author: Jurn L.
description: I absolutely love Indian food but unfortunately I dont get to eat it as much as I want to because fiancé isnt much of a fan So I was super happy to check out Sula with a girlfriend as it came highly recommended by our mutual girlfriend Between the two of us we shared the Butter Chicken and Gobi Aloo along with Garlic Naan for me and Tandoori Naan for her Everything was super delicious We chose a Medium spicy level for the Butter Chicken and it had the perfect kick to it The Naans came out warm and fresh The Gobi Aloo tasted great as well We had enough leftovers for dinner Overall it was a yummy lunch Also received great service Highly recommend
name: Sula

author: Lyndsay P.
description: Truth be told Ive eaten out far more than my reviews point to...Covid is exhausting and it hasnt been top of mind BUT this place I only popped in for a happy hour snack and drink I will return for the full menu that looks amazing The snacks were so yummy but the best part about this place was the warm and welcoming atmosphere The servers were so incredibly kind I havent had service like it for as long as I can remember Just felt like I was visiting someones home Comfortable with hosts that were attentive and just so genuine Will return for a full meal and will update then too
name: Sula

author: Aerica W.
description: Love the interior here and even their cutlery cups/glasses were beautiful Staff were super friendly and accommodating Nice and cozy place for drinks and conversations 1 oz for 7 and 2 oz for 10 Came here for their Happy Hour menu drinks I came here on a Saturday Sat  Sun Happy Hour 2-5pm weekday hours vary I believe roughly 3pm or 4pm to 6pm Our order Indian Summer tequila pomegranate pink salt lime Unique and tasty drink as I dont see pomegranate drinks often or ever anywhere else Western Ghats vodka cherry lemonade sparkling water  Im personally not a fan of cherry but my friend said it was delicious and refreshing with the added bubbles from the sparkling water Nagpur orange grapefruit soda lime  I really enjoyed this one it has a neat citrus-y blend with a kick Tandoori Wings 9 super flavourful and juicy wings with a tasty charred flavourful Highly recommend this  Beautifully presented drinks that pack a punch Might as well 2 oz everything Also tried their chaat savoury snacks on a separate visit which are popular and typically served at road-side stalls or food cars in India My order Samosa Chaat the samosas were HUGE and very very filling so I would recommend sharing if youd like to try other dishes Spiced potatoes onions and peas are stuffed in a savoury pastry Its also loaded with a lot of toppings house-made chutneys sauces Indian yogurt and my personal favourite which were these crunchy mini-sticks on top sorry I dont know the name of it Sev Puri wheat balls w various fillings Hollow crunchy wheat balls which already taste great by themselves and are filled with a bunch of stuff as well including chickpeas onions cilantro pomegranate etc Highly addictive bited-sized and vegan Vada Pav fried potato dumpling in bread The bun is amazing its toasted on butter and has a great chewy texture The fried potato dumpling tastes like a mini samosa to me Also very filling Overall everything was very flavourful This restaurant definitely pays attention to details  their food flavours decor service everything
name: Sula

author: Marci H.
description: Very warm and inviting room excellent service and amazing quality food The cocktails are creative and delicious the prices are reasonable Will definitely be back again and again
name: Sula

author: Krista R.
description: The service and quality of dining at Sula is fantastic I love all their dishes but what makes them unique is their Indian street food the Railway is a family favourite dont miss out
name: Sula

author: Matt B.
description: Really happy to see a second Sula location this one even closer to home And for them to open during the pandemic they must be doing really well We ordered takeout one evening and went to pick up the food when ready 45 mins later Menu is nearly identical to the original location with an exclusive vegan section of items I am happy to report theyve replicated the original location in terms of the awesomeness of the food We ordered the veg jalfrezi gobi aloo and the bhindi okra all medium-hot which was perfect spice level might be a bit much for some  as well as a couple tandoori rotis ask for no butter to ensure its vegan Total 53 after tax which is a little spendy for Indian food but totally worth it for the high-quality of the food  and we had enough for one for meal the next day Wonderfully complex flavours not too oily rich without being overwhelming and generous portions And their dishes have loads of veggies and arent too saucey or thin like many Indian places Overall Sula remains our favourite Indian restaurant in Vancouver Top recommendation
name: Sula

author: Jeannie Y.
description: Flavours in Sula is better than the previous restaurant I had samosa chat and cheese and garlic naan The samosa was just lightly warm I was hoping for fresh piping hot and crispy I also hoped it be spicier However I did enjoy the varied texture profiles between the chick peasfrom the sauce and the topping of thin red onion slices  Also enjoyed the sweetish/sour/salty flavour notes all in one dish The garlic and cheese naan was yummy I bought butter chicken to take home I asked for spucy level just a bit above medium Although flavorful I received mild to medium spiciness Id ssy the ambiance and staff were courteous I would go back again
name: Sula

author: Michael L.
description: Came here during Dine Out Vancouver during COVID I reviewed their web page prior to booking and it was nice to see the COVID protocols they had in place including temperature checks on patrons When we arrived they did not do the temperature checks on us nor on any of the other patrons that followed They have installed large plexiglass screens between tables for COVID protection and all the staff wore masks I was satisfied with the COVID compliance so now onto the review The room is beautifully re-done from the old Reef restaurant that used to occupy the space for the past 21 yrs We ordered off the Dine Out Vancouver menu 30 per person knowing that this would be a lot of food we were not disappointed We ordered the spinach potato onion pakora and the chicken tenders as appetizers Both were great tasting and both were large portions For the main I ordered the chicken tikka masala hot spice level coconut rice and the naan The dishes came out in beautiful dishes and again the taste of each were great The naan was sooo good and they did not hold anything back on the hot spice level I barely got into the main before I was full...again nice large portion size For dessert we sampled the mango coconut rice pudding and the almond pistachio rasmalai cheesecake These were nice refreshing desserts after such a large meal They provided us take out containers and we left with meals for 2 persons The service was exceptional I liked that they brought a large pitcher of water and left it on the table for patrons to fill their glasses We had a chance to meet the owner and he explained how he selected this location trying to find an area with no Indian establishments in close proximity Sula is a welcome addition to the Main St  Mt Pleasant restaurant scene It was a very positive food experience and I am happy to recommend Sula if looking for Indian food in the area
name: Sula

author: Eileen R.
description: Delicious A great place to satisfy your taste buds Im going back Butter chicken with garlic naan and a dish from the chaat menu Im going back to try more
name: Sula

author: Regina P.
description: The food was presented very nicely but not as tasty as expected The service was quick but when I tried to add a seat to our reservation and requested for inside dining they told me they were completely booked up So we were stuck in a little corner on the patio while there were plenty of seats inside that would have accommodated 1 more person I think for this reason wont be back
name: Sula

author: Chloe C.
description: Somewhat expensive but decent portions Food tasted fresh Channa Saag 4.5/5 Asked for mild but was more like mild-medium Very flavourful with lots of chickpeas I enjoyed this Bhagare Bhaigan 4/5 Asked for mild but this one wasnt spicy at all unlike the Channa Saag which is strange Sauce is tomato based and was nice although I wasnt a fan of the grated coconut on top Baby eggplants were nice and tender but I still prefer regular eggplant Eggplant Bharta is my favourite and Bhagare Bhaigan doesnt come close has nothing to do with the restaurant
name: Sula

author: Danny K.
description: What an excellent new addition to the Vancouver ethnic restaurant scene A mixture of delicious Indian curries and street food In particular the dhai puri was amazing as was the saag paneer In addition excellent service thanks Mithu food handling and atmosphere Only minor thing if any is the food lacked a bit of depth of flavor that you often find at classic Indian restaurants May be the result of catering to a more North American pallet Overall amazing and well definitely be visiting again and taking our friends
name: Sula

author: Aditya G.
description: Our server was great The ambience is very good But thats it  it was all downhill from there The girl at the front was really not in the mood to be there and behaved as if she was tired and pissed The food is the main disappointment  this is not Indian cuisine This is what these people think is Indian cuisine and their interpretation is way way way off the mark I cant even call this whitewashed food because it was just tasteless garbage with good plating
name: Sula

author: Yuka T.
description: I visited this restaurant because I wanted to try Indian curry It was very delicious The naan had a nice garlic flavor that matched the curry very well I had a chicken curry milder it was good because it had a rich flavor Also the waitresses were cheerful and made the meal enjoyable
name: Sula

author: Jerome D.
description: This was a fantastic dining experience  it starts with extremely friendly staff  great atmosphere and a lovely fire in the stove keeping the restaurant warm on a cold  wet day  our server was also excellent  suggesting food to try  and all was very tasty satisfying and beautifully presented will definitely recommend and return
name: Sula

author: Nye M.
description: Ordered the portobello mushroom appetizer Asked specifically that it not be spicy It was spicy The server then began to explain why they dont ask for spice levels with appetizers as they come as they are Would have preferred she tell me that as I ordered it not when she checked in with us after we took a few bites Their Instagram page makes the food look amazing Its doesnt quite look like that in person Frankly overpriced for what it is
name: Sula

author: Jack D.
description: Incredible laid back service with delicious and authentic dishes Great patio good music and lots of unique cocktails Must try Dahi Puri
name: Sula

author: Chris P.
description: Drove into Vancouver heading to an Asian restaurant it was marked Open but when we arrived it was closed due to Family Day We were so hungry we checked out what else was close by Sula had great reviews so headed there We were greeted by a pleasant waitress name Katika  hope I got the spelling correct I asked for her recommendations and they were absolutely delicious The food matched the service My only suggestion for the restaurant is to serve filtered water as the water had a lot of chlorine
name: Sula

author: Sangeetha M.
description: I think this may be my new favourite place for drinks I made a reservation and came by around 5:30 on a weekday hoping they have happy hour The crowd was mostly people grabbing a drink after work Its an interesting place seats more than it looks like it could and was not busy A reservation isnt required during the week Great service very attentive and amazing selection of drinks I like the whole theme atmosphere and little details that preserves bits and pieces of what this area previously used to home theatre and stock exchange I got a few bites to share too and I enjoyed the food I really like the pate but a friend of mine didnt The meatballs were a hit and gnocchi was alright I tried a couple whiskey based drinks and they were strong yet tasty Their bartender sure knows how to make drinks Only downside is theres no happy hour and the drinks are in the pricey side
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Tracey O.
description: 3.5 stars I went with my gfs during covid  super quiet on a friday night Their special was buy a drink and get a FREE pasta dish It was such a great deal I was expecting the pasta to be small and meh but it was actually pretty good The other tapas were good too but nothing amazing Service as great too Only con was there was a very loud obnoxious table near us that kept screaming throughout the dinner  otherwise Id probably pop by again
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Julia W.
description: long review again but what did you expect frm julia this is first of my christmas/holiday gatherings with frds ofc started off with my foodies a and s this place is the cutest bar/pub/drinking place ever there are stairs involved once you enter the place but its downstairs when you go in and then up when you leave so...hey i managed so everyone else should be able to too  since this is a drinking place the food menu is limited BUT the food was good also armand sp was our server for most of the night until he had to leave and then megan sp was helping us at the end of it he explained the menu provided suggestions and was very attentive whenever we needed him idk if i am proud to say that ive tried all the gts on the menu  except the classic cuz...yeah i am the gin queen amongst my frds so  no surprise there out of the 4 i liked all of them tho the sundowner is on the sweeter side  so watch out cuz i downed that WAY too quickly i think i like the harmony and burlesque ones the most burlesque is the one of the cocktails that they make on the carts  you can see a little cart picture beside the drink on the menu that signifies itll be made there s got her usual extra dirty vodka martini with olives a pretty much shared the gts with me lol but the last drink that she got  the spy who loved me  was everything megan said it was basically alcohol in a cup it was great but that might be why julia super tipsy at the end there now now dont wry  we did eat we ordered the meatcheese bread and armand was super nice to add the corned beef that they make in the kitchen onto it OMG THE CORNED BEEF IS SO GOOD the other highlight of the board was the mustard  we had to order another side of it it was that good we also ordered the pâté bruschetta  i love how you get everything in one bite because they already spread the fig jam onto the bread also the number in front of the appies is how many servings/pieces youll get  just fyi we also heeded to armands suggestion of the meatballs which had a bit of a kick to it but they were oh-so-moist def going back even tho ive tried all the gts alr
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Sara M.
description: This place is a lovely addition to the downtown core I really enjoyed the speakeasy vibe in here but would echo that the lighting could be taken down a few notches to really make that sing The service was fantastic Our server was incredibly knowledgeable about the entire menu and really took the time to walk us through the selections and make suggestions Our cocktails were delicious and appropriately boozy and having one made on the bar cart was a fun touch It did seem a little tricky to move and ensure the eye line wasnt obstructed especially once some overly enthusiastic guests started a stand up party but whatever its fun We shared the vegan bruschetta and the green goddess I wish we would have just ordered the bruschetta over and over again because IT IS SO GOOD The Nelson the Seagull bread really ties the whole room together The lighting could very well be a safety issue I mean boozy cocktails + all those stairs + sexy lighting could potentially = falls
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Gayan P.
description: New bar great old-school cocktail bar atmosphere with expensive drinks Certainly worth a try if youre into well-crafter cocktails Not the place to go if youre watching your budget
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Nick C.
description: This is one of Vancouvers newer drinking rooms Its small but ample room reminds me of a New York City underground speakeasy The menu consists of small and sharable plates We had the gnocchi and the meatball skewers both delicious I had a couple of non alcoholic cocktails both of which were delicious unique and refreshing I will return just for those alone The staff were both friendly and knowledgeable on their drink selections The table side cocktail carts are a nice touch but a bit clunky I could see them being an obstacle when its busy My only complaint would be with the lighting It was too bright for such an intimate setting When I walked in from street level and went down the stairwell I was really expecting it to be a bit more darker and warmer tying into the theme of the stock market from yesteryear Growing pains though It will all come together
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Olga S.
description: A classy yet cost place with staff that goes out of their way to be friendly make you feel welcome and special Theres a number of cocktails made table-side which provides for extra entertainment The food menu is on a smaller side although some snacks are mouthwateringly delicious Wish they add more vegetables like blistered shishitos or broccolini Cocktails are pretty exciting
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Alexis L.
description: Great place great food great service if you are in the mood for a good plate of cheese this is the place
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Goat M.
description: This is my new favourite place The food is great the cocktails are fantastic We had a meat and cheese board to start and the duck confit We will be back
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Nadja G.
description: Awesome place fantastic food amazing service and incredible drinks Very unique decor and ambience due to the historic setting A new must visit in Vancouver
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Arun B.
description: First visit here Newly opened restaurant The service was good but someone would come every 3 to 5mins to check on us a bit excessive Decor was nice Food was good but menu seemed very small They had a good amount of vegetarian options Extensive cocktail list but they will cost you anywhere from 14 to 20 Lighting is horrible hard to take pictures I would go back
name: Open Outcry & Pop Salt

author: Patricia L.
description: Finally got the opportunity to visit Loving Hut Express a food truck by Yaletown-Roundhouse that specializes in vegan burgers and fries Ive been meaning to check them out for a while but since we dont live in the area and they are only open Thursdays to Saturdays I hadnt been able to make it out until today I went with my husband and we ordered the Crispy Chickn Burger and the Sunshine Teriyaki Burger respectively They use Gardein brand patties for their burgers which are delicious and we both really enjoyed our food Its really great seeing various vegan food trucks around the city and Loving Hut has a great location in Yaletown close to False Creek  The lady working there was really friendly giving us a run down of the menu and also directing us to good places in the area to sit and enjoy our food That was definitely above and beyond the kind of service Ive received from food trucks in the past Looking forward to coming back and trying some of their other burger options next time
name: Loving Hut Express

author: N H.
description: Crispy chicken burger  All day long I usually order two I sincerely wish this place was a building and not a truck and that they were open more
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Anna C.
description: Cash only compassionate vegan food truck Yaletown folks you guys are so lucky to have this right outside your high rise Loving Hut offers a decent selection of vegan burgers and sandwiches I got their mushroom cheese burger and the flavor was bomb Didnt get a chance to try their other stuff but the Teriyaki Pineapple Burger looks delicious too Side order fries came to me piping hot Everything was made fresh to the order and the folks were real friendly too
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Simon S.
description: SLOOOW service on the Saturday I was there Looked like newbies in the food cart which made for a long lineup and a long time to get our one burger Grilled Mushroom Cheese Burger in Gluten Free Bun 9 +$1 for gluten-free bun My friends order so I didnt get to try this but she said the vegan patty was crunchy Hmm Gummy daiya cheddar cheese also kinda gross looking Dont look just eat Cheese Fries 5 or 4 with burger Portion is OK Cheese is some sort of pulpy mix that didnt have the same gummy texture of the Daiya that was in the mushroom burger Tasty for being salty Pretty decent for 14 and the fries can help make it a filling meal Even without the fries the size of the burger is pretty decent for 9 I wouldnt spend half my lunch hour waiting in line and waiting for my order though TIP Look for their truck that pulls the food cart Its probably nearby at metered parking which they have to feed periodically I just think its a curious indication of the cost of doing business
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Sara M.
description: Oh yep yep yep Dirty delicious vegan food The peeps that run this truck are so nice Sure the food takes a while but be cool and wait Crispy Chickn burger avec yam fries Holy hell it was good Its way better than your memories of a McChicken kids Way better The Bacon Cheezeburger was pretty good too But for reals get the Chickn Get fat who cares
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Linda L.
description: They do not update their schedule and worst of all do not follow their schedule Clearly stated on google that they were open  they werent No one answers the phone  terrible business practices Wasted an entire trip to Yaletown for no reason Theres better vegan options in Vancouver  avoid this unpredictable one
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Johnny J.
description: I thought I was going to love this place I love supporting vegan businesses but I was mistaken They DO NOT adhere to their schedule If you live far from Yale town and want to take a gamble based on if they feel like opening on the day youre going then its your risk to take Honestly dont waste your time on a business that doesnt care about its customers
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Sophie C.
description: Delicious Today Ive tried for the first time the teriyaki burger was super tasty and I will def go back for more of that
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Jane R.
description: I got the crispy chickn burger and it was amazing Definitely worth a try if you are in the neighbourhood I love how its vegetarian yet you forget you arent eating chicken It was tender and crispy at the same time Worth the wait
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Nicole B.
description: The BEST vegan burgers in town I love love love this little food truck Two elderly lovely ladies run this joint and everything is vegan and made with love  Hard to catch when theyre hours are and be patient its only two ladies and usually a line up but well worth the wait Cash only
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Emily B.
description: Amazingly delicious We got the crispy chicken burger and the grilled mushroom burger and neither of us could stop talking about how delicious they were the entire time Crispy chicken was moist and delicious grilled mushroom burger patty actually tasted like chargrilled meat how and the toppings on both were absolutely scrumptious Worth the trip to Yaletown
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Trilia N.
description: Waaa I want to cry Had gluten free burger and yam fries and it was soooo good Total price was 13 Very fulfilling Cant believe it was vegan wouldnt need meat if I could cook like this Very good gluten free bun too The dipping sauce with the yam fries was delish too
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Chase R.
description: When it comes to vegan food Im a sucker for anything that has fake chicken in it This place was perfect for that as it had a vegan chicken burger The price was a little expensive for me 10 for a burger but it was worth it Ive had the brand of chicken they use in the past but never battered and fried and omg let me just tell you how amazing that tastes Im from Montreal and we have nothing like this I just hope someday we do because I am totally going to come back to this location when I visit again
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Ernest J.
description: Isnt the point of a vegan or vegetarian restaurant to make their food taste like meat The more the food tastes like meat the better the restaurant is I dropped by my local Loving Hut with my friend He was telling me about their mushroom burger and some yam fries Ok the food was pretty good The yam fries were crispy crunchy and the chipotle dipping sauce are a perfect match The hamburger was surprisingly good It was moist and tasty Ill have to come back to try their other offerings
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Tram V.
description: Augh I usually poke fun at my friends who are vegan  mostly about their limited food choices and if todays menu of twigs and leaves will be altered in any way So when my friend asked if I wanted to have a vegan burger from Loving Hut of course I said big fat nope But being the indecisive person that I am and not being able to find anything else to eat for lunch I promptly joined her to this bright yellow food truck Guys I cant believe Im saying this but its the BEST burger Ive had Even better than the juicy meat burgers I like to shovel into my mouth Fantastically seasoned and just grade-A delicious
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Shonah M.
description: This is 1 of my favourite food trucks I go here simply for the crispy chicken burger Plus they sell the root beer I most enjoy as well  Virgils 2 summers ago a friend introduced me to Lovin Hut and since then summers have always been delightful He said to me  You do know that its a vegetarian burger  right  as I chomped away  mighty happy Could not believe it  tasted so flavourful and zesty Have often jumped on the CanadaLine to get to Yaletown just to get a bite  well worth the trip Burger is pricey but worth it Check out the Vancouver StreetFood App for times and location of this truck
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Jay B.
description: The staple here are the chickpea fries They are so crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside I mainly get the platter which marries a generous serving of hummus salad pita and pickled veggies alongside your main entree of choice This is actually the first place that I have enjoyed tempeh They slow simmer it in curry and onions The result pure bliss I actually feel healthy after dining here Its hard to say that with most dineouts
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Nicole F.
description: This is the best food truck that has ever existed My pal Bruce and I made plans to have lunch here on Friday After seeing the daily menu on their facebook page I knew I was going to have the Bacon Cheeseburger I was going to annihilate it With my face Bruce ordered the BBQ Onion Ring Cheeseburger and we sat down and waited IT WAS SO TASTY The bacon was smokey crispy and salty The beef patty was perfect and not at all dry or bland There was even some kind of vegan mayo on it as well as some typical burger condiments AND CHEESE SAUCE Made of daiya I think It was saucey messy hot and delicious I got it all over my lap and I regret NOTHING I didnt feel all gross and sluggish after I ate it either I felt great Ill probably be back like every day
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Felisa G.
description: I ordered the yam fries and there chicken burger and it was delicious and tasted almost real
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Suman L.
description: I tried the gluten free spicy burger and it was fabulous The bun tastes great and the service was pleasant Its so nice to have more gluten free options esp via food trucks I will definitely be back
name: Loving Hut Express

author: Lindsey D.
description: I like vegetables This restaurant makes you love vegetables Ive visited 6 times in 3 weeks Ive even made trips to eat by myself to try the rest of the menu It is a complete meal that energises you Post meal One is full but has energy Its amazing Some of my favourites are Monkey Mushroom and Pea Tips the sauce and execution is divine Jai 6 different types of wheat gluten in different dressings Beancurd Skin Roll in Black Bean Sauce texture seasoning amazing Sweet and Sour Pineapple Delight Spicy Green Beans Veggie Pork Slices  when in doubt Monday-Thursday post 5pm Dinner Combos Staff are super nice and speak English Cantonese and Mandarin Street Parking can be tough
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Jia N.
description: This is my absolutely favourite vegetarian restaurant It has such a great variety of vegetarian food and the quality and portion of the food is just amazing and so worth it The service is really friendly Takeout is 10% off and they also accommodate takeout in reusable containers bonus for my wallet and the earth Even when I order take-out in person they prepare the take-out so quickly Mine and my familys favourite dish is the Monkey Head Mushroom and Oyster Mushroom on Pea Tips So Good My brother says it reminds him of abalone and always asks for this dish whenever we order takeout from Sun Bo Kong Other dishes we have tried are Beancurd Skin Roll with Black Bean Sauce Sweet and Sour Pineapple Delight and Deep-Fried Emoji Mushroom on Soft Tofu with Broccoli All of which were really good Super happy that such a vegetarian restaurant exists here Definitely my go-to for amazing food
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Sofie P.
description: Another amazing meal I had a small dinner with my bubble and we got Spring Rolls a fave all around Spicy Udon delicious Singapore Noodles a surprise fave of mine Fried Tofu my personal least fave as the tofu was either soft or medium and I was hoping for something firmer but everyone else enjoyed Overall a definite go-to place for great vegan  vegetarian Chinese food
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Tracy T.
description: We normally come for dinner but I just found out they do dim sum too not sure if its just for weekend though Food here has great taste and quality Some of them are really outstanding like gluten combinations my favorite The service is generally good though I was a bit annoyed during my last trip The lady who served our table keep recommending items to my husband when we already ordered a good amount of food My husband was starving and had no self-control so we ended up double ordering and had sooo much left over to go
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Karen S.
description: Delicious vegetarian food in Vancouver BC Located on Kingsway Huge menu with lots of choices including rice dishes noodle dishes and hot pot Service was spot on Dinner for four adults including dessert was 75 We will definitely be back
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Chloe C.
description: Service wasnt the best but that was to be expected Its very busy and crowded from when we came at 11 to when we left at 1 the place was constantly packed Lots of menu items to choose from but items take a while to arrive There is a tea and water fee of 1.10 per person Spring rolls 4/5 Pretty good but could use more filling and were rather oily The exterior was crispy and flaky which was nice BBQ puff pastry 1/5 We didnt finish this The puff pastry was greasy and the filling tasted weird and way too sweet Skip this for sure Deep fried turnip cake 4.5/5 Easily one of the best dishes that we got My only complaint is that it was too oily as the flavour was good Deep fried chilli tofu 3.5/5 Not too oily but a little lacking in flavour and it wasnt spicy at all The tofu was still nice and soft inside which was good Siu mai 0/5 We all hated this It was slimy and mushy and my grandpa even felt sick from eating it Spicy green beans 4/5 These were pretty decent They were flavourful and not that spicy Pan fried vegetable buns 1.5/5 The bun was okay but there was basically no filling and I find that unacceptable XO radish cake 4.5/5 These were very good but were too oily and the batter that they used to deep fry this was a bit too thick Pan fried veggie dumplings 3/5 Average The skin was way too thick Plain rice rolls 3/5 Also average Tapioca pudding 4.5/5 The crust at the top was so good It was served piping hot and the dish was super flavourful It even had some red bean paste at the bottom Overall there were some hits and some misses I found a lot of their deep fried items too oily and definitely skip all their fake meat items but Im going to give them another shot for dinner
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Leena S.
description: Im a big fan of dim sum and being a vegetarian it cant get any better then this Great options on the menu whole variety of items you can choose from The fake meat actually tastes really good and good flavours
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Jess S.
description: I will definitely order from here again but wiser for the next time I ordered 3 dishes and that came to just over 55 I really enjoyed the food and all the yummy veg options that were available I wish there was more descriptions in the menu but its just my preference I ordered Assorted Vegetables Chili  Pepper Deep Fried Tofu and Pan-Fried Oyster Mushroom on Broccoli The Assorted Vegetables came on a bed of noodles and the noods to veg ratio was perfect The tofu was excellent Not greasy and mild spice I prefer heat  but this is perfect for most spice levels The mushroom dish was my least favorite It was a bit too salty for me The food was good I think its an awesome veg option to order with a big group so you can taste multiple dishes I definitely will try this place again
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Samuel C.
description: A Great Great Great Vegetarian Restaurant If you are on Kingsway and you pass Sun Bo Kong and you can not go in to eat say you are busy or you have an appointment You should at least stop in front of Sun Bo Kong put your palms together in praise and bow at least once before continuing on your way This restaurant is that good    Note that this is NOT repeat NOT a Chinese fake meat restaurant Unlike the many many Chinese vegetarian restaurants run by the Supremely Well-Dressed and Legitimately Wise Master Ching Hai there is no chicken made of gluten fish made of gluten beef made of gluten pork made of gluten or hot dogs made of gluten The Ching Hai restaurants are fine places to eat  but they are generally celebrations of the miracle of gluten Sun Bo Kong is about vegetables as vegetables Vegetables as vegetables in 532,838 different magnificent manifestations The menu is huger than huge My vegetarian wife who normally gets to order from one section of the menu called vegetarian and has only one to eight choices at any restaurant literally found herself overwhelmed with pages and pages and pages of choices  all of which she could have Her happiness knew no bounds About one fifth of the menu is vegetarian dim sum Those items were particularly stellar I never got to try my wifes steamed vegetable dumplings because the love of my life inhaled them in six and a half nanoseconds The Barbecue Buns Note  NOT Gluten Barbecue Pork buns Barbecue Vegetable buns were long narrow and cylindrical unlike the BBQ pork buns you know from Cantonese Dim Sum The pastry was buttery and flaky not unlike a phyllo dough The pastry in regular pork buns is gummy The dominant taste was in the pastry not in the filling as is the case the pork buns you are used to It was vegan Nevertheless it was pure buttery golden goodness The filling  Barbecued Something possibly palm root or taro  played a savory supporting role We were in absolute heaven My main dish was what they called a traditional vegetarian hotpot Hotpot lovers take note They had a whole two thirds of a page of vegan hotpot dishes The hotpots come in a rainbow array of flavors Traditional hotpot was Never mind the sauce Enjoy the vegetables for what they are The vegetables as they were were magnificent I could identify most of them  but they were pretty exotic Most were obscure items from a Chinese grocerys produce section or dried goods sections You know the ones I mean The ones that you dont buy even though you really want to because you dont know how to prepare the ingredients These people know how to prepare the ingredients Prepare to be both happy and endlessly entertained My wife got a three mushroom soup that was nice but not as fun as the other items The flavoring for the three mushrooms was seaweed in industrial quantities I can see how mushrooms and seaweed could theoretically get along However we both like our mushroom soups to be a little less astringent and a little more on the savory side That said with the vegetarian dim sum and hot pots we were in a generalized state of ecstasy So the mushroom soup could be whatever it wanted to be Oh  and for the record  Servings of anything that is not dim sum are HUGE Dont go overboard when you order    Overall this is an establishment of limitless inventiveness And endless vegetable treats In a city crammed with destination Chinese restaurants It is hard to say Dont Leave Vancouver without going to Establishment X But Sun Bo Kong really is an establishment you dont want to miss So if you really do choose not to eat here Make sure you to to a place that leaves you really ecstatic Sun Bo Kong will leave you really ecstatic
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Clara B.
description: Three for three excellent visits  definitely my current nom-nom Chinese restaurant of choice for vegetarian and vegan friendly dining spots Literally everything okay except the taro rolls which are better across the road weve ordered has been delish  bean curd rolls the black bean option is our favourite  drumsticks  traditional vegetarian hotpot  deep friend oyster mushrooms  hot and sour soup  their version of yin yong  eggplant hotpot The list goes on though Service has been lovely theyre friendly in a way almost like were friends that theyre having around for a meal at their restaurant Also portions are definitely generous so either dine with a group or look forward to taking leftovers home Definitely looking forward to our next visit
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Justine S.
description: Soooooooooo good Get the bean curds in black bean sauce Best Chinese food in the city  vegetarian or not Delicious but not too greasy
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Kasumi Y.
description: June 11  2019 I went for lunch with 3 girls Worst services ever they all day dreaming We had Large gluten combination the yellow one with curry and the red color are good rest of them too hard to eat and too salty Deep fried lotus roots they used dated oil to fry it too oily Crispy turnip pastry my friend told us its famous here but nothing special to me same as kirin and napton restaurant Steamed rice roll vegetarian fish and Chinese donut its tasty and crispy but rice roll was too thick Vegetarian bean curd on noodles with black beans sauce too salty for me Turnip cake with xo sauce soso Crispy seaweed besncurd wrapped with bean sprouts and mixed mushrooms this is only dish I like but its 17 Bamboo pith roll  nothing special Its about 91 + tips for 4 people lunch
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Jonny M.
description: O was in town so I suggested we check out a dim sum place that specializes in vegetarian food Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant Theyre sister restaurants to Po Kong which is directly across the street from them We dropped in on a Sunday afternoon around 12:15pm and it was busy Luckily we were able to get a table right away but if youre a bigger group make a reservation The inside is typical Chinese fashion Service is standard too Theres a couple menus but we were here strictly for dim sum Prices range in the 4.50 to 6.25 range  4x Tea  lame that they charge 1.10/person for tea Im sure if you bring your Asian grandma they can get it nullified  Steamed rice flour roll with pea tips 6.25  interestingly they bring the sauce on the side for you Decent but pricey  Panfried turnip cake 4.50  this was good Slightly pan fried but not greasy at all Think a healthy cleaner version of the usual lo bak go  Vegetable shrimp dumpling 4.95  their version of ha gow Was okay but nowhere near the real thing  Steamed mushroom dumplings 4.95  tasty filling and dumpling had a chewy satisfying texture  Panfried veggie bun 5.25  the bun wasnt pan fried enough  Mini 5-grain wrap 5.25  wild rice mushroom and some other things Solid  Panfried stuffed eggplant 4.95  the eggplant was bit too soft and gooey but the crunchy part on top was good  Steamed bean curd wrap 4.75  enoki mushroom on top This was another well excuted dish  Steamed BBQ bun 4.25  not bad but the bun wasnt fluffy  2x Corn oatmeal siu mai 4.95  you read that right Corn and oatmeal filling This was bland and the texture was nowhere like a real siu mai Skip it  Mango green tea pancake 5.95  never seen this before everyone liked it Diced mango and shredded coconut The pancake had a satisfying bite to it Stick with anything mushroom related and youll be happy Suprisingly decent vegetarian offerings at SBK 3.5 stars
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Alvin L.
description: Never had vegetarian dim sum before but I really enjoyed my experience and would come back again with my parents whom are both vegetarian The deep fried taro rolls were excellent ask for their hot sauce and so was their soup dumplings I also really enjoyed their pan fried turnip cakes and steamed dumplings If youre vegetarian this is a must try  if youre not a vegetarian I would still recommend Sun Bo Kong
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: D R.
description: Quick review for now They wouldnt serve our party because it included a disabled person and her professionally trained beautifully behaved service dog Other customers might have allergies or not like it Illegal and just horrible Go across the street to Po Kong Theyre great have a very similar menu and dont discriminate against people with disabilities Yum
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Simon S.
description: DISCLAIMER I grew up eating Chinese food and my moms wonton soup so Chinese food is comparatively mundane for me If its a delicious novelty for you then you might want to rate this restaurant higher NOTE This is a vegetarian Chinese restaurant that uses meat substitutes Part of my positive tilt on how I rate them is in the quality of the fakeness of the meat B14 Assorted Vegetables and Wonton in Soup 12.95 Overall pretty ordinary tasting In fact Im a bit inclined to give it bonus points for tasting just like my moms home cooking Not exactly thick with wontons since this is mixed wontons and vegetables and it says so right in the menu name so if youre looking for tons of wontons and just token veggies you might want to check with the server for something else to order The wontons are themselves quite interesting from a fake-meat point of view They actually taste fairly close to pork But more than that they actually make an effort to have it look like pork-and-shrimp wontons If you cut open one youll likely see a fat chunk of fake prawn It doesnt taste like prawn tastes more like bland nothing if you isolate it and taste it but the appearance is comforting for omnivores that might be missing meat C27 Veggie Balls and Mushrooms with Black Pepper Sauce 13.95 Pretty simple and tasty Sauce not too strong though so if youre worried about that or looking forward to a very strong pepperiness check with your server Except for the shape the veggie balls are pretty good at passing for tender chunks of fake chicken And camouflaged amongst the comparably sized mushrooms you might not even notice the odd shapes If youre looking for fake chicken this is probably better than the overtly fake-looking chicken options NOT swimming in oily sauce This is good G10 Baked Fried Rice with Pumpkin and Cheese 16.95 Weird to see cheese and pumpkin in a Chinese restaurant much less in the same dish I recommend you try it Its not only novel but the sauce makes it pretty tasty Its also a LOT of rice  the server rated a single order as being enough rice for five persons Certainly on its own its a meal for two It does NOT taste like Kraft cheddar mac n cheese Nor does it taste like someone melted an awful lot of cheddar on top In fact it doesnt taste like cheese so much The sauce that doesnt harden up like cheese when it cools kind of tasted to me like a sweet not-spicy-hot curry The pumpkin comes in small wedges with some of the green skin on but baked enough to be tender and sweet Make sure you scoop up some Service very friendly and helpful to non-Chinese speakers Not a lot of small tables for 2-4 so if youre a duo you might get stuck with a small table basically at the kitchen exit and the only other option is only a bit farther away
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Colin L.
description: This is my fave Chinese food in Vancouver They are also SOOO nice and honest The last time we were there when we ordered the server down-sold us because she said it was too much food She was right Haha
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Kwok C.
description: So far the best vegetarian Chinese restaurant we have found in Pacific Northwest Has extensive choices of dim sum lunch and dinner entrée Our go to place whenever we visit Vancouver area
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Ruben M.
description: This place is fantastic for their dim sum for any vegetarian Im glad that this was an option We came here for dinner and got the Chili Eggplant with Tofu hot pot Fantastic Unfortunately their Singapore curry noodles were pretty flavorless The dim sum was fantastic and would recommend to anyone who is vegetarian or vegan and even remotely likes Chinese food Definitely give it a look
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Karen C.
description: Food was so-so a little disappointing We ordered a lot of different dishes to get a good feel for this place Im afraid the only thing we liked was the noodles we ordered to go with the wonton dish We thought we ordered wonton noodle soup but apparently not so had them add that Service was average
name: Sun Bo Kong Vegetarian Restaurant

author: Jinsae H.
description: Ratings based on food quality alone Appetizers Caviar and Oysters  7.2/10 An incredibly creamy bite that introduces you to the world of shellfish umami The distinct sensation of the sea is refreshing instead of overpowering and there is no unpleasant aftertaste Summer Corn Chowder  3.8/10 As the name suggests a very light and subtle aromatic starter Unfortunately aside from the lobster tail it was a little too subtle for any flavors to leave a lasting impression The texture was neither that of a chowder nor a soup somewhere in between akin to a froth Baby Back Ribs  8.1/10 One of the better lightly sauced Asian-inspired braised ribs on the market The tenderness is executed to an industry T and the sesame glaze makes even returning to the plate for just garnishes worth it Entrée Scallop and Crispy Pork Belly  8.4/10 If there was a contender for most bang for your buck at this establishment this dish is sure to be the strongest Nothing short of artisanal and technical excellence with pork belly crusted two-way a layered herb crust and a multi-nut crust combined with butternut squash purée and plum chutney as sauces The scallops dissolve on the tongue as if you were having a second helping of corn chowder and the pork belly added the perfect contrast with a scrumptious crunch The squash purée and lobster tail add-on were appreciated but were not as memorable in comparison to the main attractions especially when paired with the plum chutney that was just the right amount of sweet with hints of a chili kick Dessert Hazelnut Praline Bar  9.3/10 The uncontested star of the show There is simply not much more to attribute to this masterpiece other than that Potentially one of the most revitalizing passionfruit sorbets in fine-dining beautifully married with a crackling milk-chocolate praline bar teetering on the bitterness of a darker chocolate A further description of all the elements on this dish would not be as apropos as trying it yourself Overall Rating  7.36/10
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Drea S.
description: Came back to Hawksworth again a few times after the first time to give it another chance I have to say theyve impressed me They not only have incredible food drinks and service are all mind blowing Thank you guys for all your hard work Updating my review and letting you guys know this place is worth giving another try Not only did I try it again once but I tried it over and over again The quality of the menu and the friendliness of the staff stayed consistent over the last few visits Thank you guys
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: John S.
description: Taste of Hawksworth Lunch Prix Fixe 25 Available Mondays  Fridays from 11:30am-3:00pm crispy duck salad pomegranate vinaigrette baby kale sliced almonds corn risotto zucchini parmesan chives banana dulce de leche and peanut tart banana ice cream peanut praline carmelized chocolate whip The salad was a unique taste with jerky like duck meal and nice mix of greens nuts and grapes Creamy risotto was fulling and smooth The tart had scoop of banana ice cream that I was talk was a bit hit with their DIne Out Vancouver and made its comeback Shout out to bartender Joanne for her engaging personality
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Scottie M.
description: Restaurant website open until 11 yet kitchen closes at 930 Uh...thanks for nothing
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Audrey W.
description: Epic happy hour not well known but a really high end burger made to order and an old fashioned for 19 1.5 oysters that goes along with it total beyond worth it
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Jurn L.
description: Little did we know that this would be our last time dining in for at least 3 weeks Enjoyed an amazing meal at Hawksworth Restaurant on Sunday night March 28 We ordered Appetizers  Kusshi Oysters  Crab and Sidestripe Shrimp Toast  Charcuterie Platter  Alberta Beef Steak Tartar  Mushroom Risotto with Truffles special Entrees  Yarrow Meadows Duck Breast add-on Foie Gras  Sablefish add-on Lobster Tail  Crispy Pork Belly  Roasted Scallop add-on Lobster Tail The meal was phenomenal Everything tasted absolutely delicious I really cant pick a favourite because it was all so good Our server Eric provided exceptional service It couldnt have been a more perfect meal before the dine-in hiatus
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Charna B.
description: Thé 3 course lunch here is the best deal going Me and my foodie group come here usually every second week when the lunch menu changes Service is always fantastic This weeks lunch was the best Started with a chickpea panisse which is like a fritter Main course was lightly seared tuna in an amazing curry which I have to admit I licked the bowl  dessert was a raspberry lemon earl grey tart Lunchtime could not get better than this  oh and try the lavender vanilla house made ice tea Its so refreshing and feels like you are in Provence
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Renee W.
description: What a fabulous spot for a romantic and classy date night We came here for Valentines Day and had the 6 course menu and it was absolutely amazing The pairings were all unique yet flavourful and delicious  not to forget the plating Unfortunately I cannot remember the names of all these plates  The service was great and the food came at the perfect pace and we will definitely be coming back for more
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Luke Y.
description: Price/quality 4/4 Got the tasting menu and every course tasted amazing The salad looked particularly impressive while the fish was great too The tiramisu was the one that blew me away--it had all the traditional flavours but it was presented as something that was deconstructed Service 1/1 Service was friendly and effective Would I come here again Yes They currently have a patio too
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Vineet S.
description: First time to the restaurant with my colleagues and was highly disappointed with the food Really expensive for very small portions and tasteless food I ordered a lobster roll it came in Texas toast and had no taste to the food The presentation was similar to a food truck offering My colleagues also were not impressed with their orders Will never go back and not recommend to anyone
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Loewe C.
description: Came here to celebrate our anniversary and we were blown away by their exceptional service and professionalism during covid We felt safe the facilities were clean and the food was delicious We ordered the seafood platter steak tartare beef tenderloin sablefish caramel pot de creme and the apple tart We really enjoyed our mains and desserts and appreciated the handwritten card and complimentary sparklings They were also very accommodating to my request to change out the beans in the sablefish for another ingredient All in all a perfect night and a great option if you are celebrating a special day The Hawksworth team really tries their best to make your night special Read my full review on my blog https://sincerelyloewe.com/hawksworth-anniversary-dinner
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Amy D.
description: My husband and I celebrated our 20th anniversary at Hawksworth and it by far surpassed our expectations From the minute we were greeted at the door to the end of our meal we were blown away by the service and attention to detail not to mention the food Thank you to the entire staff for making it a memorable experience We cant wait until we can visit again
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Jan Dustin G.
description: They are open during the pandemic with very specific ways to keep diners safe They are by reservation although it will be a long wait if you want to walk-in The ambiance is beautiful with enough spaces to socially distance Its noisier than I expected but bearable The food is exquisite and that is where the strength is It took time for them to prepare our food but it was worth the wait I like the KFC the seafood platter and the Wagyu burger also the duck breast We tried the foie gras and my partner absolutely loved it The servers are nice and they explain everything they serve We ate so much we did not have room for desert will try next time though
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Christina L.
description: Good food and service here I like that its classy but relaxed without being pretentious The steak and eggs at brunch are delicious and so are the macarons The fresh orange juice was kind of bitter for some reason which was too bad We also enjoyed the bennys and French toast I liked the steak so much that Ive orders it twice already Some of the tables are very close to each other so conversations can get a bit loud and when the waiter was cleaning the table next to us we couldnt help but notice that the waiters bum was right next to us like really close No biggie though haha
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Manbir R.
description: Vancouver city is blessed with abundance of food places including some top chef/michelin award winner fine dinning restaurants like hawksworth Chef david hawksworth planted his lavish restaurant inside the immaculate lobby of rosewood georgia hotel vancouver very accessible n easy to find As usual parking is on the road so better walk here from nearby parking lots We got lucky to get parking right around the corner Warm and inviting ushers/hosts take ur name down to check ur reservations n then ur coats if u wanna hang them safe We did the same and got our token number A lady guided us to our table and along the way  we were greeted by most of the staff members in a welcoming manner The moment we sat down to observe the ambiance i really liked the well layed cutlery on the tables many staff members standing probably to keep check of their respective tables assigned A beautiful big painting of a book cover was eye catching Dim lights and modern decor just finished the touches of fine dine restaurant Menu was full of globe spanning list of liquor like wines champagne,whiskeys,vodka,rum,italian vermouth n angostura some base of herb n spices So let me tell you that a drink called indulgent Manhattan worth 125 will hit you in seconds Its sour though n its just 3 oz I dont know why but our server asked us twice if we wanted that drink worth 125 I would say maybe we got to dress little more expensive to proof our wealth money honey Fine dinning here doesnt mean tiny portions just to make the plate dirty but actually serves the purpose hunger Menu is definitely fine tuned every now and then to bring new additions of local and seasonal ingredients Winter BC jan menu page had very interesting choices but we sticked to our vegetarian options only Surprise there were some Our brussal sprouts appetizer was very very delicious with a tinch of sweetness maybe maple syrup Salad with chickpeas was quite fulfiling  Duck breast was well cooked as i suggested I am sure we ordered brassica as our main course instead we got something else but my BF doesnt like to create a scene so he had the vegetarian bowl which was fried brocolli n other veggies in a very tangy sauce  that took the 5th star away Rest all was perfect Eye pleasing plates knowledgeable service paired with expertly addressing of all staff members I would say its absolutely worth the splurge and i would do that again
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Susan R.
description: I booked a few weeks in advance GM sent a message to personally say thank you for the booking I messaged him back that we were specifically coming for the tasting menu Then a day before I was reconfirm and a discussion even took place about what was on the tasting menu 3.5 hours prior to our scheduled seating we were called to advise the tasting menu was no longer offered Seriously This was my 50th birthday booking and they were well aware the ONLY reason we booked was for the tasting menu Try getting another reservation elsewhere for a well rated restaurant in Vancouver with 3.5 hours notice Sadly this restaurant will go down as the least professional I have ever run into and Ive traveled extensively worldwide Shame on you and your General Manager Josh should be tossed
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Yuri Y.
description: Walking in on a Monday night with one other person and sat in the lounge because the restaurant was full Not surprised given its attached to a hotel and its a well known place Cocktails were very good Moon Milk was mezcal almond milk lime grapefruit falernum angostura bitters and s as cinnamon stick I will order this again for sure if I come here again I also got a Bacardi 10 years old fashioned which was great As for food everything was great but not life changing See photos for what we ordered This was a good amount of food for two hungry ppl Stand outs were the soup cheese plate and banana ice cream The cheeses were all amazing The only thing I didnt really like was the scallops  too salty but might just be me The carrot cake was pretty good and it had these gelatinous carrot flavored strips over it which was special One other thing that really stood out was the bartender who was mainly attending to us Taku He was attentive and friendly and gave excellent drink recommendations Really enhances my dining experience Id come here again for sure for food but it was as little expensive so not a casual frequent thing I did expect that and am definitely not complaining about it though I will likely come more frequent too just sit at the bar and make my way through their cocktail menu
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Clara C.
description: Stopped by Hawksworth on a weekday for lunch and it was a pleasant fine dining experience with mostly older couples tourists and working professionals as the usual dining audience Items Tried Sea Bass  34 4/5 Taste The sea bass was quite fresh and flaky with a crispy skin that complimented the flesh of the fish well The braised fennel was cooked to just the right texture not too soft not too crunchy However I thought the overall appearance of the dish was a bit lacking and the saffron broth that the dish was drenched in was not super appetizing to eat/look at Portion Size On the smaller side for 1 person  satisfying if accompanied with an appetizer and/or dessert Dark Chocolate Chantilly  14 5/5 Taste The dark chocolate was fantastic it was a decadent mousse like texture that was not too overly sweet and paired well with the raspberry chocolate Portion size Smaller dessert size for 1 person Value for Money The high price point is well-matched by the amazing restaurant ambiance the high quality food and the exceptional service I had an overall wonderful experience at Hawksworth
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Emily L.
description: Dined here about a month ago The food was 4 stars but the service was terrible I complained the manager promised me a gift card and have yet to receive it after a month Also recently they have had a case of COVID amongst staff We want to support restaurants but our money is hard-earned too so I expect a certain level of customer service and good quality food if I am spending over 150 for lunch for two Where is my gift card Seriously Dont promise something if you cant deliver
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Sharon L.
description: So we booked online a month prior to coming here for lunch 2 weeks before we emailed them asking if we can have 1 hour later than our time we wanted originally booked our flight time had changed and we even called and left a message no one answered back 24 hours before our reservation date they emailed stating that the 1pm reservation was ok They need to improve on answering back faster to customers because of their lack of response we booked another restaurant for brunch as a backup My family took the steak and eggs and it was delicious and cooked perfectly to their desired taste the beef brisket was very tasty and juicy the cod was very good The meat and fish dishes were very excellent As for the vegetarian dishes there were not many choices only 3 I took the ratatouille dish It was good but nothing special The ratatouille lack of flavor I had to add salt and pepper I wished they would have put more effort into their vegetarian dishes.The desert was delicious The service was good too
name: Hawksworth Restaurant

author: Mel J.
description: If all vegan pizza were all this good I would eat it everyday I order 3 pies stranger wings carne asada  ultraviolet for my family Stranger wings was absolutely the favorite The cauliflowers wings were cooked perfectly  not soggy The sauce was super tasty Just like eating the real wings sauce Order this if youre hesitant to try vegan pizza Our second favorite was carne asada We were surprised that the vegan steak curls were super delicious The pineapple gave a fresh palate cleanser that complimented the pizza The Ultraviolet was good too but the other 2 pies blown our taste buds so much that overshadowed it Personally I think that the cashew mozzarella is the important ingredient that makes all the pizza tasted delicious The crust had the perfect thickness that the pizza wasnt soggy I would definitely order more
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Leeza N.
description: Ive been to this Virtuous Pie location since their very first opening and I can say Im a huge fan Ive tried many of their items here my favourites being the Superfunghi pizza the ultraviolet pizza and the mac and cheese VP does vegan food so well that it doesnt feel like what youre eating is a vegan version of a dish it just tastes so good They also use really fresh ingredients and the staff is always friendly I like how now you can sit down and they take your order compared to before where you had to pay at the till VP is a solid choice when it come to high quality delicious vegan food
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Nicole G.
description: I order VP regularly via Door Dash The garlic knots pictured are hands down my favourite item on the menu The sauce they come with is equally great The Superfunghi Pizza is delicious as is the kale salad It feels like quality clean eating food My preferred vegetarian restaurant in Vancouver
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Leah M.
description: It cost me 54.00 for these two pizzas that were cold and squished when they were delivered
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Annie P.
description: What is there to say about VP that hasnt already been said Is this place a portal to an alternate dimension where everything is beautiful and nothing hurt If eating is your fav coping mechanism then YES Does Virtuous Pie have the answers to all of lifes unanswerable questions If you cant answer those questions because youre hangry then YES Does Virtuous Pie make vegan food fun/accessible without being scary and intimidating YESSSSSS There are few things I enjoy more than a stranger wings pizza with extra garlic ranch and side of garlic knots bread on bread on bread baby If you havent been GO NOW If you have been GO BACK And bring me a pizza while you are at it
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Julia H.
description: This is a great place for vegan pizza one of the best I would say It can get quite busy on the weekends and you may have to wait 15-20 mins for your pizza Everything is freshly made and its really light I would say its more like a flatbread than an actual pizza since its not as saucy and cheesey My favourite is the stranger wings buffalo cauliflower Super flavourful and yummy Would also get their kale salad and tator tots on the weekends
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Sara W.
description: When my friend decided to go vegan for the month and said we should eat here Ill admit I was a little wary How good could vegan pizza be As it turns out its absolutely delicious perhaps even better than your standard pizza Making a good pizza dough is an under-appreciated skill so I have mad respect for whoever makes the dough here There was a perfect balance between chewy and crispy I got the superfunghi which was excellent but as soon as I took a bite of my friends mac + cheeza pie I could not focus on anything else I never say this about pizza but it was to die for AND IT WAS VEGAN We also got ice cream They have a nice selection of flavours and the ice cream itself was delicious but it paled in comparison to the pizza The next opportunity I get Im going back and I think we all know what Ill be ordering
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Breanne T.
description: Finally got to try virtuous pie I didnt realize it was kind of a cafeteria/subway style restaurant but it was quick and easy It was quite busy when we got there but we were able to grab a seat on the end as there is limited seating Love the ambiance We had to try the Mac and cheese which I dont regret at all Definitely hard to finish it all though when we ordered a pizza each We got the mushroom one and the one with cauliflower Both very good and a perfect personal size I think there couldve been a little more cauliflower/ingredients on mine but it was still very good We enjoyed our pizzas Mac and cheese and beers will definitely be visiting again soon to try all the other pizzas that sound amazing
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Chloe C.
description: Honestly I wish I could say that I loved this place since I had a fantastic vegan pizza from Leef and Stem a week ago Unfortunately the pizza I got was disappointing and so Ill have to look elsewhere for some good vegan pizza I also got some sushi from the Harken Coffee collaboration which was decent Sweet Pepper + Sausage Pizza 3/5 I was so excited for this but this pizza fell completely short of my expectations The pizza dough was very chewy and had a strange texture while the cheese was spongy and plasticy My meat-loving vegan-food-hating brother ate two slices though which was very surprising though I did pick all the cheese since it tasted strange and sweet peppers he hates those off by then The sausage mince was decent but was definitely mushier than real meat The seasoning was a bit spicy which was nicely balanced by the hot honey The honey definitely added a unique touch but the pizza definitely needed more of it to counteract the heat There was a decent amount of toppings but I do wish there was slightly more meat This pizza was underwhelming and I wouldnt get it again Inari Sushi 4/5 The flavour was nice and mild and I liked how the bean curd pocket wasnt sickly sweet like those you normally get at regular sushi places I wish there was more filling and sauce since it was quite heavy on the rice I couldnt really taste the sesame sauce on the spinach but I thought the addition of tempeh was interesting Spicy Tuna Roll 4/5 The flavour of this roll was good and my non-vegan brother had no idea that it was tomato and not tuna I liked the crunch from the pumpkin sunflower and sesame seeds on top but I definitely would have liked more filling since Im not really a rice person and I just want the filling It also wasnt spicy at all which I was completely fine with since Im not the biggest fan of spicy foods anyway If youre looking for good vegan pizza I would go to Leef and Stem I personally think that this place is overhyped but to each their own
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Mimi Y.
description: Mmm much better than the UBC location The crust was nice and chewy much more like regular pizza and I liked the flavours I chose this time a lot better I went with the Superfunghi which had great mushrooms on it It was still slightly bland so the tableside parmesan sriracha and chili pepper flakes were helpful I also tried my friends Street Corn and Pesto CBR I think I liked the Sweet Corn the best because it was sweet and savoury great if you like Hawaiian pizza loaded with corn kernels I liked the chicken on the Pesto CBR but it was also slightly bland We also shared some garlic knots and they were very delicious Chewy and well seasoned by parmesan and bacon and of course garlic They didnt skimp on the garlic The ranch dipping sauce it came with was also yummy I also liked that they had both sparkling and flat water on tap
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Sofie P.
description: Ill stick with the pizza next time which are bomb I wanted to try something new so I got the garlic knots which were really good and the Mac and Cheese Skillet which was not I didnt enjoy it at all The cheese had a kinda sweet taste to it I cant explain it Not a fan
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Caroline L.
description: My mother switched to a vegan lifestyle couple months ago and I was so excited to try Virtuous Pie with her We decided to get  Margherita Pizza 12  Stranger Wings 14 Because margherita pizza is my favourite pizza and obviously wanted to try the famous vegan wings My mom and I instantly fell in love Both tasted so SO delicious Their wings  seriously though How on earth does that taste so much like real wings I swear I could not tell the difference My mom was obsessed with the cauliflower wings Although both pizzas were delicious their ALMOND PARMESAN CHEESE was SO amazing I am a huge fan of parmesan but I thought this tasted even better My tip would be to sprinkle it A L L over your pizza Next time Ill probably bring more people so I could try more options bigappetiteproblemss lol and go during Happy Hour because they have great deals I recommend Virtuous Pie to anyone who loves pizza
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Emily S.
description: OMG SO GOOD I never knew vegan pizza could be this delicious P My friend and I ordered the super funghi and the grandma I preferred the grandma because it was flavourful creamy and unexpectedly satisfying didnt miss dairy cheese at all The funghi was good but I felt it needed a bit more oomph so I covered it in almond parmesan The almond parmesan definitely helped but next time I might see if I can add toppings to the grandma I think the grandma with mushrooms would be heavenly A few other notes the atmosphere was stylish with large group tables meant for sharing with strangers Which fostered a nice community environment Wouldnt do an intimate date there but great for friendly hangouts The staff were polite and friendly The washroom was massive...just wish there was more than one washroom Maybe we were there at peak hours but there was a bit of a wait for it Otherwise the place is pretty perfect another gem in the crown of vegan restaurants in Vancouver HIGHLY RECOMMEND
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Kristin U.
description: Update Almost a year since my last visit I was able to go back for more vegan icecream They were out of the gluten free waffle cones oh no But the man working suggested a gluten free ice cream sandwich instead and I jumped on that I ordered the mint chocolate icecream  the one I loved most last time It was perfect with the chocolate chip cookie Such a satisfying treat Virtuous Pie lived up to my hopes and dreams Ill be back Went to explore Chinatown today and did a quick Yelp search for gluten free food before I left I am SO glad I did because it led me to Virtuous Pie I saw they had a gluten free waffle cone and vegan ice cream and knew I HAD to go there I found the shop pretty easily as we walked the streets There was a sign on the door saying their AC was broken and it was quite warm inside But the smell of pizza and allure of vegan ice cream prompted me inside They had about five ice cream options today and I couldnt quite decide so I went with two scoops of ice cream in a gluten free waffle cone I got a matcha and coconut scoop and a mint and dark chocolate scoop You guys I cannot say enough good things about this ice cream It was SO tasty The mint and dark chocolate was by far my favorite Oh I could eat pints and pints of that The matcha was pretty good too And the waffle cone Perfection I cant even tell you the last time I could walk into a place and grab an ice cream cone Next time Im in Vancouver I know exactly where Im headed for a treat And maybe Ill actually get some pizza next time too
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Amy C.
description: Had the chorizo and artichoke pizza which was delicious Flavorful toppings/sauce and crispy crust The vanilla bourbon ice cream was also yummy but I ordered one scoop and got more of like half a scoop TLDR give their pizza a go ice cream flavors are good but portions are small
name: Virtuous Pie

author: Stephanie T.
